loans.name: Severa

texts.es:
La señora severa es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora cuenta con 53 años de edad y está casada con el señor santana quien es campesino, tienen 2 hijos los cuales ya están casados y cada quien tiene su propia familia, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de quesos , desde hace mas de 20 años.

Dice que decidió invertir en esta actividad, porque quiere ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, ya que trabajaba demasiado y no gana lo suficiente para tener una buena solvencia económica, también así poder contar con una mejor calidad de vida, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de leche, sal y cuajo.

Una de las metas que tiene doña severa para su negocio, es la de hacerla crecer muchísimo, ya que está pensando en mas a delante ampliar un poco su local, ya que quiere comprar más tinas, bandejas, coladoras y charolas para agilizar su producción, puesto que así mejorara e incrementara mucho mas sus ingresos.

Le da las gracias a fundación realidad y a los prestatarios de kiva, por todo el apoyo y confianza que le están brindando, ya que esto le servirá de mucho puesto que ahora puede continuar invirtiendo en su negocio y apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Severa is a very enterprising, hard working woman.  She’s 53 years old and married to Santana who is a farmer.  They have two children who are already married and have their own families.  She has been making cheese to sell for more than 20 years.

She says that she decided to invest in this business because she wants to help her husband with household expenses since he works too much and does not earn enough to have good economic solvency.  Also, she can have better quality of life.  The loan she got will be used to buy milk, salt and rennet.

One of the goals Severa has for her business is to make it grow very much because she’s thinking later on to enlarge her locale a bit because she wants to buy more tubs, trays, strainers and trays to ease production because that way she will improve and increase income much more.

She thanks Fundación Realidad and Kiva lenders for all the support and trust they are giving her because this will help her quite a bit because now she can continue investing in her business and supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy milk, salt and rennet.

loans.name: Leandro Martín

texts.es: Leandro es un joven que está estudiando la carrera de Ingenriería de Sistemas, está solicitando el crédito para pagar el curso de titulación. Tiene un cyber el cual es administrado por él, y de esta manera ha podido costear sus estudios. Quiere triunfar en la vida, tener un buen trabajo y ayudar a su familia. Su mayor inspiración es su madre por el esfuerzo que ha hecho para que él pudiera salir adelante, también le inspira el hecho de poder llegar a ser una persona importante en su comunidad.
texts.en: Leandro is a young Systems Engineering student.  He has an Internet-leasing business that covers some of his college costs, but he needs a loan to pay for what the business doesn't cover.  He wants to make a success of his life, to have a good job and help his family.  His greatest inspiration is his mother.  She has worked hard to make sure that he has a good chance to succeed in the world and become an important member of his community.

loans.use: to pay college costs.

loans.name: Petronila Margarita

texts.es: Petronila trabaja en un instituto como maestra, está por finalizar su carrera de Ingeniería en Sistemas y está solicitando el crédito para pagar el curso de titulación y obtener su título. Sus sueños son poder montar una empresa y también desea seguir preparándose académicamente mejor. Porque de esa manera mirará todo el esfuerzo que le dedicó a los estudios todos éstos años para ser una buena profesional y ayudarle a su familia.
texts.en: Petronila works as a teacher in a school.  She is about to finish her degree in Systems Engineering and is requesting a loan so that she can pay for her degree certification course and obtain her degree.  Her dream is to set up a business and she would also like to continue improving herself academically.  This will justify all the hard work that she put into her studies over the years so that she could become a good professional and help her family.

loans.use: to pay for her degree certification course

loans.name: Delma Rosa

texts.es: Delma es una joven estudiante de la carrera de Ingeniería en Sistemas, es casada, y junto a su familia desea poder salir adelante. El crédito solicitado es para pagar el curso de titulación de su carrera. Sus planes son poder al fin coronar su carrera y poner en práctica los conocimientos adquiridos en una empresa que solicite sus servicios, espera poder ayudar a su familia y tener un propósito en la vida. Tuve dificultades económicas a lo largo de todo el periodo de sus estudios, pero pudo superarlos y salir adelante.
texts.en: Delma is a young student in the field of Systems Engineering. She is married and wishes, along with her family, to be able to get ahead. The requested loan is for paying for the final stages of the degree program in her field. Her plans are to be able finally to cap off her degree and put into practice the knowledge she has acquired in some business which may seek her services. She hopes to be able to help her family and have a purpose in life. She had financial difficulties throughout the entire period of her coursework, but was able to overcome them and continue forward.

loans.use: to pay for the completion of her degree program.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Maliha

texts.en:
Maliha is from Israel’s southern region. She lives and works in a Negev town. For over 20 years Maliha worked in agriculture, carrying out back-breaking jobs for low wages. In 2008,  she opened a small mini-market that serves her neighborhood. The mini-market proved successful and now she is expanding it, introducing a larger range of products.

Maliha needed this loan to purchase stock and expand her mini-market.

In the future, Maliha wants to continue and expand her market and become a general store that serves not only her neighborhood and surrounding area but the entire city.

loans.use: To purchase stock and expand her mini-market.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de dos cerdos y concentrado para alimentar los cerdos y el ganado, esto le ayudara a crecer en la granja de cerdos y mantener el alimento para varios meses.
El manifiesta haber tenido una buena experiencia con su préstamo anterior, que utilizo para mejorar su negocio, con el objetivo de tener más ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Pedro is applying for a new loan to buy two pigs, and concentrated feed for his pigs and cattle. This will enable him to expand his small pig farm, and maintain the animals' feed for several months.  

He says that he has had a good experience with his previous loan, which he used to improve his business, with the aim of having more income.

loans.use: To buy pigs and concentrated feed.

loans.name: Mrimo Group

texts.en:
This group is called MRIMO. It consists of seven members:  Khadijah, Hana, Hiah, Nwal, Shmah, Shfigah and Hiam who are mainly married women and average 28- 40 years of age with two to five children each. They live in Sana`a, Yemen. The members of this group are very trustworthy, responsible, hard workers. They have all known each other for a long time and know each other well. They have so many clients, mostly women. The whole group took out a loan of 330,000 YER.

Hiam is the group leader, 46 years old and a widow (she is on the right side holding a red and white dress in the photo). She has two children; the older is 5 years old and the younger is 3 and they live in Sana`a. Hiam has been operating a  sewing business for over five years. 

She chose this business because she loved it since childhood. She started to study to be a tailor in a sewing institute thus she developed her business by dealings with traders who support her to buy patterns of fabric and robes for stitching. 

Because she is a professional in stitching, she requested a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to purchase sewing machines and more fabrics to grow her business and attract  more customers. 

In the future, she dreams of saving money in order to purchase more machines to ensure that she can continue working and have a good professional career.

loans.use: to purchase sewing machines and more fabrics to grow her business and attract  more customers.

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en:
Ghada is a 35-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and a mother of five children.

Ghada is requesting a loan of 300 JD to do house maintenance with an aspiration of improving her family's living condtions.

loans.use: to do maintenance for her home

loans.name: Wallace

texts.en:
Wallace is a married man. He has two children and one is enrolled in school. Wallace operates a motor vehicle transport business. He's worked in this business for five years. His primary customers are local area residents. He describes his greatest business challenge to be rising prices of fuel and his highest monthly expenses are for food and house rent. He rents a house that has both electricity and piped water. 

Wallace will use the Kes 50,000 loan to purchase spare parts to repair his motor vehicle. Wallace aspires to expand his business in the future. He joined Yehu to access funds to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to repair his motor vehicle.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a 45-year-old married woman with seven children; all of them are in school. She has had a food stall in Kator, South Sudan for six years.

Regina is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase tomatoes and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and onions for sale.

loans.name: Nadir

texts.en:
Nadir is a 56-year-old man, married with three children.  He sells food products as macaroni, rice, candies, cookies, sugar and beverages in his shop.  Nadir has 12 years of experience in this field, which makes him a knowledgeable and skilled person.

The food product he sells are very popular among people and are in high demand. His monthly profit from selling foods is 250 AZN. His wife helps him to sell products in the shop. He is a very successful entrepreneur because of the good location, in the central bazaar of his home city.

Nadir would like to increase his sales and invest additional capital. For this purpose he applied for 1500 AZN. He will  diversify and purchase additional foodstuffs. He has a positive loan history and this will be his second loan.

loans.use: to buy more food products.

loans.name: Sana'a

texts.en:
Due to cultural issues, Sana'a refused to have her picture uploaded on the internet; instead the man in the photo is her husband Tamer

Sana’a is a 20-year-old married lady from Madaba, Jordan and a mother of one child.

Sana’a is requesting a youth loan of 600 JD to do house maintenance with an aspiration of improving her family living conditions and raising their living standard.

loans.use: to do house maintenance.

loans.name: Aliah

texts.en:
Aliah is a 25-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and a mother of one child.

Aliah is requesting a youth loan of 400 JD to do home maintenance with an aspiration of improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to do house maintenance.

loans.name: Doa'a

texts.en:
Doa'a is a 20-year-old lady from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan. 

Doa'a is an ambitious lady thus she started her own business selling clothes from home. She is requesting a youth loan of 500 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) to purchase more quantities for trading purposes. 

Doa'a is looking to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for trading purposes

loans.name: Jose Miguel

texts.es:
José, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, ya que le parece el servicio que ha recibido y además que con estos préstamos logra realizar lo que con su ingreso normal no puede cubrir. Él comprara postes de energía eléctrica y cables con ellos instalara la energía de calle, para mantener alumbrado su patio y calle, evitando cualquier riesgo delincuencial.
Él tuvo un efecto positivo con su préstamo anterior, mejorando su negocio y las condiciones de su familia.
texts.en:
José has decided to apply for a new loan, because he likes the service he has received.  Also, with these loans he is managing to do what he can't pay for with his normal income. 

He will buy power poles and cable for bringing power in from the street, so that he can keep his patio and driveway lit, avoiding any risk of crime. 

He had a positive experience with the previous loan; improving his business, and his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy power poles and cable.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 37-year-old man from Kakamega town, in the west of Kenya and is married to Niver. They have  three children  aged 11, eight and four years.

John operates a cereal sales business, a business he has done for the last 14 years, making a monthly income of 10,000 KES. He is taking his first loan from KADET LTD which he will use to buy more maize and beans. His profits will be used to buy more cereals.

His dream is to always have a stable quantity of cereals.

loans.use: To buy a stock of maize and beans.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is a 47-year-old married woman with seven children; four of them are in school. She has had a business selling beer in Kator, South Sudan for five years.

Sabina is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beer. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beer for sale.

loans.name: Doa'a

texts.en:
Doa'a is a 20-year-old single lady from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan. 

Doa'a is trading in cosmetics and perfumes, thus she is requesting a youth loan of 700 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) to purchase more cosmetics products. 

Doa'a is looking to open her own shop so that she can increase her income and expand her customer base.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and perfumes for resale

loans.name: Shahrazad

texts.en:
Shahrazad is a 28-year-old married woman from Al Aqaba, Jordan and a mother of three children. 

Shahrazad is requesting a youth loan of 800 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) to do home maintenance and purchase appliances. 

Shahrazad is looking to improve her family's living conditions and improve their living standards.

loans.use: to do home maintenance

loans.name: Baha'a Al Dein

texts.en:
Baha'a Al Dein is a 20-year-old single man from Sahab, Jordan.

Baha'a Al Dein has his own barbershop and he is requesting a youth loan of 1500 JD to purchase equipment and machines needed for the barber shop.

Baha'a Al Dein is looking to expand his business and increase his income so that he can  improve his family's living standards and improve their life conditions.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and machines needed for the barber shop.

loans.name: Heba

texts.en:
Due to cultural issues, Heba rejected having her picture uploaded on the internet. Thus, the man in the photo is her husband Lo'ai.

Heba is a 23-year-old married lady from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and a mother of two children. Heba has a home-based business through which she helps her husband by selling baby's diapers. She is requesting a youth loan of 1,200 JD to purchase more goods so that her husband can distribute the diapers via his bus.

Heba is looking to purchase a home for the family.

loans.use: to purchase goods such as baby diapers to sell

loans.name: Qamar

texts.en: Qamar is a 25-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan, and she is the mother of three children. She sells clothes from her home and she is requesting a youth loan of 500 Jordanian dinars to purchase more clothes. Qamar is looking to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for trading purposes

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Cristina is a 30-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has 2 children, ages 8 and 4, both of whom go to school. 

Cristina runs a small tea business and she has been in the business for 3 years. She has 1 employee. She heard about Finance Sudan through fellow clients. She is taking a loan of 1,500 SDG to purchase more food items like sugar, tea leaves and many others. Cristina has no other source of income in addition to this business. 

In 5 years time, she would like to hope for a big set up restaurant. 	Her major challenges include home expenses because of the high standard of living in Juba.  She says that she is happy for Finance Sudan’s support in South Sudan.

loans.use: to purchase more food items like sugar, tea leaves and many others.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth  is 32 years old, lives in Airport community, and    she has a ten-year-old child who is in school and lives at home. For the past  six  years, she has been selling "red oil" (palm oil) in the market, She is requesting a loan to purchase more "red oil" for her business. Her plan is to build herself a house.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil (palm oil) for her business

loans.name: Rana

texts.en:
Due to cultural issues Rana was not willing to have her picture uploaded on the Internet so the man in the photo is Rana's brother.

Rana is a 24-year-old divorced woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan and a mother of one child.

Rana has a beauty salon and she is requesting a youth loan of 600 JD to purchase equipment and machines needed for the salon. Rana is looking to purchase her own car.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and machines for her salon.

loans.name: Sagitario Group

texts.es: La señora Victoria pertenece a la alcancía comunal Sagitario ubicada en el distrito de Lurigancho Chosica, esta alcancía está conformada por 7 integrantes las cuales son mujeres con muchas ganas por salir adelante y tener éxitos en sus negocios, una de ella es Victoria de 40 años de edad, conviviente y  madre de 3 hijos, uno de ellos es mayor de edad  y dos a su cuidado. Victoria trabaja limpiando pollos en un establecimiento de ventas de aves  y en este trabajo lleva trabajando 4 años con el ultimo préstamo quiere hacer realidad su meta dedicarse a la crianza de porcinos comprando crias y de comida balanciada para los animales. La crianza de  estos animales es muy difícil pero para Victoria es el trabajo que se quiere dedicarse  día a dia, ella quiere comenzar con esta crianza a raíz que le regalaron dos cerditos pequeños y le han enseñado a cómo debe de trabajar, con este negocio quiere costear los estudios de su hijo mayor.
texts.en:
Victoria belongs to the Sagitario communal bank located in the Lurigancho Chosica district. This communal bank is made up of seven members who are all women with a great desire to get ahead and be successful in their businesses. 

One of these women is Victoria. She is 40 years old, is in a civil union and is the mother of three children. One of them is an adult and two of them are under her care. Victoria works cleaning chickens in business that sells poultry. She has been working there for four years. 

With this last loan she wants to realize her goal of making a living raising pigs by buying young ones and animal feed. Raising these animals is very hard, but it is the work that Victoria wants to do on a daily basis. She wanted to start the business when she was given two small piglets and shown how to work with them.  

She wants to be able to pay for her oldest child's studies with this business.

loans.use: to buy young pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 23-year-old married woman from Al Nasser, Amman, Jordan and she is a mother of one child.

Yasmeen sells clothes and she is working from home. She is requesting a youth loan of 400 JD to purchase more clothes to sell.

Yasmeen is looking to have her own shop and  a car for the family.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for business purposes

loans.name: Layla

texts.en:
Layla is a 29-year-old single woman from Al Nasser, Amman, Jordan. Due to cultural issues Layla was not willing to have her picture uploaded on the internet thus the man in the photo is Layla's father, Ali.

Layla is a tailor and she is requesting a youth loan of 500 JD to purchase fabrics. She is looking to open a shop for her business instead of working from home.

An aspiration of Layla's is to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics.

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Dennis is a married man. He has 1 child who is enrolled in school. Dennis operates a retail shop. He's worked in this business for 4 years. His primary customers are the local area residents. He describes his greatest business challenge to be transportation and his highest monthly expense is food. He rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. 

He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to purchase more stock of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, beans, detergents and cooking oil for resale. He aspires to establish a wholesale shop in the future. He joined Yehu to access funds to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, beans, detergents and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is 26 years old, married, and blessed with two children, ages three and one. She has a boutique business she started three years ago and she earns an income of about KES 20,000 per month. 

She has requested a loan of KES 50,000 which she will use to purchase cosmetics, jeans, trousers and sweaters to sell. The anticipated profit will help her expand her business. Her dream is to expand her business and become a wholesaler as well as to educate her children. This is her second loan from KADET LTD.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics, jeans, trousers and sweaters to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, beans, detergents and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Mwadime

texts.en:
Mwadime is a single man. He describes himself as God-fearing and focused. He operates a retail business where he sells soft drinks such as sodas and water. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located near a beach and his primary customers are foreigners and local people visiting the beach.  In addition, he is a photographer which increases his income. 

Mwadime describes his biggest business challenge to be disturbances by local authorities. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase more soft drinks to sell such as sodas and water. His business goal is to run a similar retail stall within five years.

loans.use: to buy more sodas and water for resale.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan, desea realizar una nueva compra de chatarra y material para el taller de estructura como hierro de diferentes medidas, esto le ayudara para continuar firme en su negocio, esta inversión la realizara a través de un nuevo préstamo, con el cual espera mejorar la disponibilidad de material.
Él considera estar en mejores condiciones, y que ha crecido en clientela.
texts.en:
Juan wants to make another purchase of scrap metal and materials for his metal shop, like different sizes of iron. This will help him to continue on strong with his business. 

He will make this investment with a new loan. He hope this will allow him to improve the availability of these materials. He believes he is in better conditions as his customer base has grown.

loans.use: to buy scrap metal and materials for his metal shop.

loans.name: Jehad

texts.en:
Jehad is a 29-year-old married man from Al Baqa’a, Amman. Jordan.

Jehad  is requesting a youth loan of 400 JD to purchase some equipment to do blacksmith work since he is a blacksmith but has no workshop.

Jehad is looking to rent a shop and start working from there so that he can improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to use for his blacksmith's work.

loans.name: Esra'a

texts.en:
Esra'a is a 21-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and a mother of two children.

Esra'a sells perfumes and cosmetics and she is working from home.

Esra'a is requesting a youth loan of 500 JD to purchase cosmetics and perfumes for her business with an aspiration to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and perfumes for business purposes.

loans.name: Nisreen

texts.en:
Nisreen is a 19-year-old married woman from Al-Hashmi, Amman, Jordan.

Nisreen sells cosmetics and perfumes and she is requesting a youth loan of 400 JD to purchase cosmetic products and perfumes.

Nisreen is looking to open her own shop for cosmetics with an aspiration of improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and perfumes for business purposes.

loans.name: Reema

texts.en:
Reema is a 23-year-old married woman from Al Hussein, Amman, Jordan and a mother of two children.

Reema is looking to improve her family's living conditions thus she is requesting a youth loan of 400 JD to do maintenance for her home. An aspiration of Reema's is to purchase a car.

loans.use: to do maintenance for her home.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 25-year-old married man from Sahab, Amman, Jordan.

Ahmad has a restaurant and he is requesting a youth loan of 1,000 JD to improve his restaurant and purchase some materials needed.

Ahmad is looking to open another branch of his restaurant so that he can increase his family's income and meet all their demands.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the restaurant and do some improvments to the layout

loans.name: Ala'a

texts.en:
Ala'a is a 29-year-old married man from Al Balqa'a, Jordan. 

Ala 'a sells vehicle spare parts. He was working at a vehicle electrical workshop, then he opened his own small shop after a while so he could increase his family's income and improve their lives. 

Now, Ala'a is requesting a youth loan of 2000 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) to purchase more vehicle parts for his shop with an aspiration of opening a mechanic's store in addition to purchasing a house for his family.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts

loans.name: Maha

texts.en: Maha is a 29-year-old married woman from Al Hussein, Amman, Jordan, and the mother of two children. She is a tailor and is requesting a youth loan of 600 Jordanian dinars to purchase raw materials (fabric, thread, etc.) She is looking towards purchasing a house for her family with the aspiration of improving their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials (fabric, thread, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stock of iron sheets and other materials for his business.

loans.name: Heba

texts.en:
Heba is a 27-year-old divorced woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan.

Heba sells clothes and cosmetic products. She is requesting a youth loan of 500 JD to purchase more clothes and cosmetic products for business purposes with an aspiration of increasing her income and providing her children with better living conditions, in addition to ensuring their higher education expenses.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and blankets for business purposes.

loans.name: Ahlam

texts.en:
Ahlam is a conservative person so she was not willing to have her picture uploaded on the internet, thus the man in the photo is her brother.

Ahlam is a 22-year-old single lady from Marka, Amman, Jordan.

Ahlam is a tailor; she started her project from home, then she hopes to be able to expand the business into a workshop outside the home.

Ahlam is requesting a youth loan of 500 JD to purchase a sewing machine. An aspiration of Ahlam's is to purchase her own car.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Heba

texts.en:
Heba is an 18-year-old married lady from Al Hasmi, Amman, Jordan. And she is a mother of one child.

Heba sells clothes and she is requesting a youth loan of 400 JD to purchase clothes for business purposes with an aspiration of opening a shop for her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for business purposes

loans.name: Asma'a

texts.en:
Due to cultural issues Asma'a didn't want to have her picture uploaded to the Internet, thus the man in the photo is her husband. 

Asma'a is a 22-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan and a mother of two children. 

She has a home-based grocery store and she is requesting a youth loan of 400 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) to purchase more quantities of goods. 

Asma'a is looking to improve her family's living standards, income, and their social and economic conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Raeda

texts.en:
Raeda is a 24-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan and a mother of two children.

Raeda is requesting a youth loan of 300 JD to do maintenance for her house  with an aspiration of improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to do maintenance for her house

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has seven children, five of whom go to school. She takes care of additional family members. 

She operates a food stall selling bread, baking flour, and cooking oil. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last five years. 

Margaret has requested a loan of 800,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bread, baking flour, and cooking oil. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to buy a plot of land and build her own house and also to own a fully stocked food stall. 

She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bread, baking flour, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 28-year-old, married, and has three children. He lives in Hodeidah, Yemen. He studied for a  Bachelor's degree at Naval College. 

He purchased a motorbike (second-hand) for transport three years ago.  Previously, he had hired a motorbike so that he could start his life and cover his own personal educational expenses till he can able to buy his own motorbike.

Mohammed faced a challenge of whether to be free  to search for a  job, to join naval military forces, or to work with his motorbike but eventually could do both. 

He decided to sell his old motorbike. So he took a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to buy a new motorbike that can help him to improve his living conditions. Mohammed hopes to save money in order to replace this motorbike with a new taxi. He also hopes to send his children to private schools.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike for business.

loans.name: Elizabeth Yovana

texts.es:
Elizabeth tiene 32 años, actualmente es soltera y cría sola a sus dos pequeñas una de 6 y la menor de 1 año. Ella vive en un cuarto alquilado con sus pequeñas hijas debido a que esta no es su ciudad natal, anteriormente ella vivía en la ciudad de Ayacucho pero por diversos motivos tomó la decisión de mudarse a la costa del Perú, Ica.

Cuando Elizabeth fue abandonada por su pareja se pudo muy fuerte y decidió salir adelante con sus pequeñas, es por eso que desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de gelatinas en la calle, solo en temporada de verano, y en los meses que nos encontramos en Invierno, ella se dedica a la venta de tortas, Elizabeth nos comenta que está muy bien al lado de sus pequeñas, siempre siente que ellas son las que le dan la fuerza necesaria para continuar luchando.Esta historia trata de una mujer muy fuerte, dedicada siempre a triunfar, sabe que su trabajo es muy agotador pero siempre está preparada para continuar vendiendo.

Con la ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva podará comprar una refrigeradora, la misma que le servirá para hacer sus gelatinas, ya que constantemente le pide a su vecina que las coloque en las suya y por este servicio le cobra, es por ello que prefiere empezar a pagar algo suyo y así tener la refrigeradora disponible todo el tiempo que desee.
Su sueño es poder abrir un pequeño negocio donde pueda vender útiles escolares, debido a que ya se acerca la temporada escolar, también desea continuar vendiendo sus gelatinas y que sus pequeñas crezcan fuertes y sanas.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 32, is currently single and raises alone her two small daughters, one 6 years old and the youngest a year old.  She lives in a rented room with her small daughters because this is not her native city.  Previously she lived in the city of Ayacucho but for various reasons decided to move to the coast of Peru, to Ica.

When Elizabeth was abandoned by her partner, she became very strong and decided to get ahead with her little ones.  This is why she has worked for two years selling gelatins in the street, only in the summer season, and when we are in winter, she works selling cakes.

Elizabeth tells us that she is very well at the side of her little girls.  She always feels that they are the ones that give her the strength necessary to continue fighting.  This story is about a strong woman, always dedicated to succeeding.  She knows that her job is exhausting but she always is ready to continue selling.

With the help of the Kiva lenders she will be able to buy a refrigerator, which will help her make her gelatins, because she constantly asks her neighbor to put them in hers, a service for which her neighbor charges.  This is why she prefers to begin paying for something of her own, and have the refrigerator available whenever she needs it.

Her dream is to be able to open a small business where she can sell school supplies because the school year is approaching.  She also wants to continue selling her gelatin and for her children to grow up strong and healthy.

loans.use: to be able to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es una madre de familia de 57 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad e independientes económicamente viven en un caserío rural de nombre “Caserío Finca Punto 9 – Rama Cabrera” perteneciente al distrito de Lambayeque a unos 15 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo aproximadamente. En la zona en la que viven cuentan con actividad económica principal la agricultura y la ganadería.

Isabel se dedica de manera diaria a la crianza y posterior comercialización de ganado caprino, en la actualidad cuenta con una gran cantidad de animales los cuales ha criado y engordado con gran esfuerzo, para lo que ha podido instalar en su propia casa espacios estratégicos para la crianza de los mismos, la unión entre sus hijos y su esposo ha hecho que emprendan en nuevos objetivos familiares y es que por eso trabajan diariamente para lograrlos y así mejorar su condición de vida.

Isabel al tener ya sus objetivos claros y establecidos desea comprar alimentos balanceados para el engorde de sus animales y a la vez comprar mas ganado los  que puedan aumentar sus ventas y así satisfacer las solicitudes de sus clientes. Isabel ha solicitado un crédito en Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 2000 Nuevos Soles para atender a sus necesidades.

Isabel  y sus hijos son personas trabajadoras, amables y muy respetadas por sus vecinos de la zona en la que viven, derechos que se lo han ganado en base a su trabajo, esfuerzo y dedicación al trabajo.
texts.en:
Isabel is a 57-year-old mother who lives with her husband and two children who are already adults and financially independent. They live in a rural area called Caserío Finca Punto 9 – Rama Cabrera which is in the Lambayeque district, approximately 15 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. In the area where they live the major economic activities are agriculture and animal husbandry. 

Isabel makes her daily living raising and selling goats. Currently she has a large number of animals that she has raised and fattened up with great effort. She has been able to install strategic spaces in her home in which to raise the goats.

The unity between her children and her husband has led to the undertaking of new family goals. That is why they work daily to achieve them and in that way improve their quality of life. 

Now that Isabel has well established and clear goals, she wants to buy feed to fatten up her animals as well as buy more goats so that she can increase her sales and fill her customers' orders. Isabel has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 nuevos soles to meet these needs. 

Isabel and her children are kind, hardworking people who are respected by their neighbors in the area where they live. They have gained this through their hard work, effort and dedication to their work.

loans.use: to buy feed to fatten up her animals.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 26-year-old, married man who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. His educational background is secondary school only. 

He has been running a buffet for six years in which he offers his customers all types of staple products, such as hot drinks, fresh juices and sandwiches. He says that he is already established with customers in the area. Additionally he has employed two workers in his business. The business allows him to support his family.

Mohammed is a person who is well-known and highly esteemed by his neighbors and customers, who consider him a responsible man. Also, he has been able to attract his clients because of making all types of delicious foods and tasty juices which are produced by him.

Mohammed wants to acquire more products with which he can grow his business in order to achieve his objective. Due to the bad situation in Yemen, many among his clientele have left to return to their villages. He considered it appropriate to request a youth loan of 150,000 YER from AMB to order to buy his business needs such as beans, sugar, and spices, etc 

In the future, Mohammed would like to rent another shop to be a restaurant as well as purchase a truck.

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, and spices, etc.  for his business

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is a 48-year-old man from Kakamega county, Western Kenya. He is married to Sarah and they have five children aged from seven to 19 years.

Isaac operates a computer cafe offering printing and photocopying services, a business he has been doing for the past two years. He makes a monthly income of KES 7,400 and is taking out his first loan from KADET LTD which he will use to buy a photo printer. He will use the profits to further expand his business and also to educate his children.

His dream is to expand his business so that he will be able to provide for his family.

loans.use: To buy a photo printer

loans.name: Korto M.

texts.en: Korto is 49 years old, lives in the Airport community and has seven children aged 10 to 21.  For the past two years, Korto has been selling used clothes; she enjoys the customer flow. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 28-year-old married woman with one child who is not in school. She has had a business selling breads in Kator, South Sudan for two years.

Nancy is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase breads. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase breads for sale.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman. She has five children, two of whom are enrolled in school. Fatuma operates a food stall. She's worked in this business for 20 years. Her primary customers are the local area's residents. She describes her greatest business challenge as the lack of customers and her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Fatuma will use the Kes 10,000 loan to purchase rice, beans, wheat flour and maize flour for her business. Fatuma aspires to establish a hotel in the future. She joined Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase rice, beans, wheat flour and maize flour for her business.

loans.name: Methew

texts.en:
Methew is a 40-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has eight children between the ages of three and 20, seven of whom go to school. 

Methew runs a roofing poles business and has been in the business for 10 years. He has two employees. Methew heard about Finance Sudan through outreach and promotion done in the market by the Finance Sudan officer. He is taking out a loan of 4,000 SDG to purchase more roofing poles. Methew has no source of income other than this business. 

In five years' time, Methew hopes to add the supply of timber to his business. 

His major challenges include home expenses as he is the only one to support the family. 

Methew says that he is happy about Finance Sudan’s support in his motherland and it has made him think positively about the idea of adding timber.

loans.use: to purchase more roofing poles.

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Viola is a 33-year-old married woman with six children, four of whom are in school. She has had a business selling at a food stall in Kator, South Sudan for four years.
Viola is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase bread. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fee.

loans.use: to purchase bread for sale.

loans.name: Ida

texts.en: Ida is 89 years old, and lives in the Airport Community. She is a widow with ten children aged between 38 and 52 years. They all are working and living on their own. For the past fifty years she has been involved in business. Currently, she is involved in local soap making. She is requesting a loan to purchase more caustic ingredients, oil, and wood for her business. Her plan is to build more houses for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more caustic ingredients, oil, and wood for her business

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is a 32-year-old married woman. She has three children, ages 7 to 13 years old. She describes herself as God-fearing and determined. She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables and fruits such as bananas, tomatoes, onions, kale, etc. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a fast-growing area and her primary customers are local residents. In addition, Nancy sells cereals to increase her income. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the grocery retail business. She will use this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to purchase fruits and vegetables. Her business goal is to run a big cereal shop within five years.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fruits for selling.

loans.name: Vorischon

texts.ru: Ворисчон женат и любящий отец троих детей. Более 15 лет он занимается предоставлением услуг по перевозке  пассажиров. Он очень аккуратный и активный человек. Он любит свою профессию и с удовольствием развивает свой бизнес. Он старается зарабатывать  больше для того чтобы его дети выросли в хороших условиях жизни. Ворисчон хотел бы получить займ в размере 5000 Сомони для ремонта своего автомобиля. Он надеется на вашу помощь и поддержку.
texts.en: Vorischon is married and a loving father of three children. For over 15 years he has been offering passenger transport services. Vorischon is a very neat and active person. He loves his profession and takes pleasure in developing his business. He tries to earn more money so that his children can grow up in good living conditions. Vorischon would like to receive a loan of 5000 somoni to repair his vehicle. He is hoping for your help and support.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a 25-year-old single lady from Kakamega, Western Kenya who has only herself to support.

Caroline runs a cosmetics shop, a business which she has operated for the past five years and earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. She is taking out her first loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy beauty products to sell. She will use her profits to start a salon business.

Her dream is to save for her future family.

loans.use: to buy beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Lona

texts.en:
Lona is a 27-year-old married woman with two children who are not in school. She has had a business selling charcoal in Kator, South Sudan for two years.

Lona is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en: Rukia is a married woman. She has six children and five are enrolled in school. Rukia sells household utensils. She's worked in this business for two years. Her primary customers are the local area residents. She describes her greatest business challenge to be customers not paying their debts on time and her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Rukia will use this 10,000 Kenyan shilling loan to purchase more stock of household utensils like plates, cups and others for resale. Rukia hopes to expand her business in the future. She joined Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of household utensils like plates, cups and others for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 50 years old, a mother of eight children aged between three and 22 years, and is married to Joseph. They come from Migori, West Kenya.

Mary operates a tailoring business, a business she has been doing for the last eight years, making a monthly income of KES.10,000. She is taking her fifth loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy more textile materials for dressmaking. 

She will us the anticipated profits to repay back the loan. Her dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy textile materials

loans.name: Assa

texts.en: Assa is a 45-year-old married woman with five children, all in school. She has had a business selling charcoal in Kator, South Sudan, for five years. Assa is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 34 years old and a mother of three children. She is married to Andrew.

Beatrice is a scrap metals dealer and has been doing this business for the last three years and makes a monthly income of KES. 10,000. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy more scrap metals.

She intends to use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. Her dream is to build a good house for her family.

loans.use: To buy scrap metals

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca  tiene 39 años de edad, ella vive en Chincha, Perú. Chincha es nombrado por la  cultura de los Chinchas, célebre por sus avanzados conocimientos de la agricultura y sus proezas marítimas. Hoy en día Chincha es una increíble mezcla de culturas, con una gran población afro-peruana, debido a los restos de un pasado indígena, y las influencias del imperio español. La ciudad, junto a otras ciudades cerca de la costa del Pacífico, fue dañada en el año 2001 y 2007, fechas en las que ocurrieron terremotos de fuerte dimensión, pero ha soportado como siempre lo ha hecho durante gran parte de su historia. Blanca es muy trabajadora y cuando tiene un tiempito libre disfruta de ver televisión, en especial sus novelas favoritas;   como bien se sabe el Perú se caracteriza por tener las comidas más deliciosas del mundo y uno de los platos que a Blanca  le agrada mucho es la riquísima “Carapulcra con sopa seca”. 

"Blanca tiene su negocio de venta de calzado, al cual le dedica alrededor de 9 horas diarias y puede atender hasta doce clientes diariamente , ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque brinda un buen servicio y el carisma que tiene al vender. 

Blanca está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que con la ayuda brindada podrá  comprar mercadería para su negocio en especial calzado escolar, esta mejora le permitirá tener mayor cantidad de clientes ya que se inicia la época de colegio y podrá mostrar mayor  variedad en los productos y seguir luchando día a día para cumplir su gran sueño:” Ser una empresaria de éxito."
texts.en: Blanca, aged 39, lives in Chincha, Peru. Chincha is renowned for the culture of the Chinchas which is well-known for its advanced knowledge of agriculture and its prowess in seafaring. Today Chincha is an amazing mix of cultures, with a large African-Peruvian population due to its indigenous past and the influence of the Spanish Empire. The city, along with other cities of the Pacific coast, was damaged in 2001 and 2007 by strong earthquakes, but it recovered as it always did for much of its history. Blanca is a hard-working woman and when she has a moment of leisure, she enjoys watching television, in particular her favorite soap operas. It is well known that Peru has the most delicious food in the world. One of Blanca's favorite dishes is "Carapulcra con sopa seca", a typical dish of southern Peru, made from pork, groundnuts, potatoes, noodles and chicken. Blanca sells shoes. She attends her store around 9 hours a day and can serve up to 12 customers each day. She believes that she does well in her business because she provides good service and is a charismatic seller. Blanca is very grateful to Kiva lenders because their support helps her to buy goods for her store, in particular shoes for schoolchildren. This improvement will enable her to serve more customers because the school term will soon start and she will have a larger variety of goods to offer. She will continue her everyday struggle to fulfill her dream of being a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her shoe store ahead of the school term.

loans.name: Bara

texts.en:
Bara is a 37-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has 4 children between the ages of 12 and 3 year. Three of them go to school. 

Bara runs a business selling roofing poles. He has been in the business for 3 years and has 1 employee. Bara heard about Finance Sudan through outreach and promotion done in the market by the officer. He is taking a loan of 4,000 to purchase more roofing poles. In addition to this business, Bara has no other sources of income. 

In 5 years time, Bara hopes for an increase in the size of his business. 

His major challenges include home expenses and low income rates. 

Bara says that he appreciates Finance Sudan’s support in South Sudan and God should bless the company.

loans.use: to purchase more roofing poles.

loans.name: Maritha

texts.en: Maritha is 50 years old and a single mother of five children from Migori town, west of Kenya. She has been operating a tailoring business for the last 12 years, making a monthly income of 14,000 Kenyan shillings. She is taking out her fourth loan from KADET Ltd. which she will use to buy more textile materials for sale. She will use her profits to repay the loan. Her dream is to have a big stock of clothing and to buy more sewing machines.

loans.use: to buy textile materials.

loans.name: Kalebu

texts.en: Kalebu is a 25-year-old man from Migori town. He is married to Florence and they have two children. Kalebu operates a motorcycle transport business, locally known as boda boda and has been in this business for the last four years. He makes a monthly income of 15,000 Kenyan shillings. He is taking out his first loan from KADET Ltd. which he will use to buy motorcycle spare parts. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children and improve his transport business. His dream is to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Gaffor

texts.ru: Гаффор проживает в городе Исфара. Ему 48 лет. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Гаффор занимается производством и торговлей. Он в основном печет лепешки для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается три года. Кредит берет для покупки муки и угля.
texts.en: Gaffor lives in the city of Isfara. He is 48 years old, married, and has four children. Gaffor sells products he makes himself. Mainly, he bakes flatbreads for sale, which he has been doing this for three years. He is taking this loan to purchase flour and coal

loans.use: to buy flour and coal

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a 32-year-old man from Kakamega town, Western Kenya. Richard is divorced and has only himself to support at the moment.

For the past 10 years he has been operating a photography business and earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. He is taking out his first loan from KADET LTD which he will use to buy a printer for printing his photos.

He will use the profits to repay his loan. His dream is to diversify into motor vehicle transportation.

loans.use: To buy a printer.

loans.name: Kamengele

texts.en:
Kamengele is applying for another loan to expand her existing fruits and vegetables business. She will use this 15,000 Kes loan to purchase more stocks of tomatoes, mangoes, spinach, onions and oranges for resale. In the future, Kamengele aspires to continue improving her business. 

Since taking out her last Kiva loan, Kamengele has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase tomatoes, mangoes, spinach, onions and oranges to sell.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en: Julia is a 37-year-old married woman with three children, all in school. She has had a business selling clothes in Kator, South Sudan, for five years. Julia is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Silvia Dinora

texts.es:
Silvia, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de materiales para el negocio como el maíz, aceite, condimentos, para darle continuidad al fortalecimiento del negocio, con estos productos estará en una condición estable por un lapso de tiempo, que le permita tener mejores ingresos y producción para el pago de las cuotas.
Ella manifiesta haber tenido una buena experiencia con el préstamo anterior, que le ayudo a estabilizarse y a generar mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Silvia applies for a new loan to buy ingredients for her business, such as corn, oil and condiments, and ensure the continuous vigor of her activity. Buying these products will give her stability for some time and enable her to improve her income and production to pay off her loan. She has demonstrated her good experience with handling previous loans, which will help her to strengthen her business and generate better profits.

loans.use: to buy corn, oil and condiments for her tortilla business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 46-year-old widow from Kakamega, Western Kenya and she supports four children aged 12, 14, 16 and 20 years.

Elizabeth has been operating a retail shop for the past eight years earning a monthly income of KES 9,500. She is taking out her second loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy more retail stock like sugar and rice to sell. She will use her profits to educate her children.

Her dream is to be able to provide for her children.

loans.use: To buy retail stock like sugar and rice to sell

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a married man. He has two children aged five and seven years. He describes himself as passionate and aggressive. He operates a retail business where he sells phone accessories, compact disks, etc. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are local residents. In addition, he also provides rental house services and works as an agent for M-Pesa transactions (mobile payment system) for customers. 

He describes his biggest business challenge as being the high rates of license fees charged by the city council. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase more phone accessories. Robert's business goal is to own extra rental houses within five years.

loans.use: to buy phone accesories to sell.

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es:
Blanca, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, ya que quiere fortalecer el negocio comprando materiales para la costura como telas de diferentes colores y tipos, accesorios como los zipper, botones, para la confección de prendas de vestir.
Él efecto que tuvo Blanca con el préstamo anterior fue muy bueno, ya que ha tenido materiales para elaborar los pedidos de los clientes, dándole mejores ganancias para su familia.
texts.en: Blanca decided to take out a new loan to strengthen her business. She will use it to buy sewing materials, such as fabrics of various colors and types, and accessories like zippers and buttons for making clothes. Blanca experienced a very good result with her previous loan, because she had the necessary materials at her disposal to meet the demand of her customers and thus earn a better income for her family.

loans.use: to buy fabrics of various types and colors, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a 45-year-old married woman with seven children, six of whom are in school. She has had a business selling charcoal in Kator, South Sudan for five years.

Margret is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago, quiere seguir cultivando maíz, por eso está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de insumos como abono, herbicidas, y preparar el terreno pagando los mozos, este préstamo le dará la seguridad para que sus cultivos se lleven a cabo en este periodo.
El considera haber tenido una experiencia positiva de la utilización del préstamo anterior, manteniendo a su familia en mejores condiciones.
texts.en: Santiago wants to continue growing corn. Therefore he applies for a loan to buy agricultural supplies like fertilizer and herbicides, and to pay young laborers to prepare the soil. This loan will give him the security that he needs to grow crops in this season. He believes that he has a positive experience with his previous loan, which gave better living conditions to his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Macrine

texts.en:
Macrine is aged 50 with four children aged 26, 23, 18 and 12 years. She is a poultry farmer, starting this business two years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 5,000. 

She has requested a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase chicks, feed and medicine.

The profit from her business will help her pay fees for her children. Her dream is to improve her living standard and build a permanent house. This is her first loan from KADET LTD.

loans.use: To purchase chicks, feed and medicine.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is applying for another loan to expand her existing retail shop business. She will use this 20,000 Kes loan to purchase more stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, beans, cooking fat and sugar for resale. In the future, Martha aspires to continue improving her business. 

Since taking out her last Kiva loan, Martha has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, maize flour, rice, beans, cooking fat and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Kilongawima Group

texts.en:
Magdalena, who is in her early 30s, is married with three children who are still going to school.  She has been running a beauty salon for two years now. She works from 8.00 am to 8.00 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. 

This will be her third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to put in better mirrors, put tiles near the washing sink and bought more salon equipment and has paid back both her loans successfully.  This loan will be used to increase her salon equipment and to start a food vendor business. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Kilongawima" which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase her salon equipment and to start a food vendor business.

loans.name: Oscar Osmin

texts.es:
Oscar, necesita comprarse tela para la sastrería y llevar a mantenimiento una máquina de coser, por eso está solicitando otro préstamo, le permita realizar dicha inversión, ya que con esto tendrá en mejores condiciones su herramienta para confeccionar prendas de vestir, además con la compra de tela tendrá para seguir en su actividad.
Él considera que el préstamo anterior le ayudo en su momento a solventar la necesidad de tela, para continuar prestando servicios de sastrería.
texts.en: Oscar needs to buy fabrics for his tailor's workshop and pay for the maintenance of his sewing machine. Therefore he applies for a new loan, which will enable him to make this investment and keep his tailoring tools in good working condition. In addition, the purchase of fabrics will allow him to stay in business. He believes that his previous loan solved his need to have enough fabrics in order to continue providing tailoring services in his workshop.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and pay for the maintenance of his sewing machine.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 29-year-old single man from Kakamega town, Western Kenya who has only himself to support at the moment.

James runs a barber shop, a business which he has operated for the past five years earning a monthly income of KES 9,000. He is taking out his first loan from KADET LTD which he will use to acquire a new business location. 

He will use his profits to buy cosmetics. His dream is to stabilize his business.

loans.use: To acquire new and better business premises.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a 42-year-old married woman with seven children, six of whom are in school. She has had a business selling food from a stall in Kator, South Sudan for five years.

Anna is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase sugar to sell.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is a 51-year-old man from Migori county. He is married to Lenary and they have seven children.

Samwel operates a tailoring business, a business which he has been doing for the past 10 years earning a monthly income of KES 21,000. He is taking out his fourth loan from KADET LTD which he will use to buy textile materials for dressmaking. He will use his profits to repay the loan.

His dream is to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy textile materials for making dresses.

loans.name: Juana Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Juana del Socorro es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien se dedica al comercio de postres tradicionales como son las rosquillas, roquetes, viejitas…etc. Este negocio lo inicio hace 10 años en Niquinomo.
Ella invertirá el crédito en los ingredientes indispensables para realizar este delicioso postre nicaragüense estos son el maíz, queso, cuajada, azúcar, huevo, canela…etc.
texts.en: Juana del Socorro is a hard-working and enterprising woman who sells traditional Nicaraguan pastries, such as donuts and jelly filled cookies. She started this business 10 years ago in Niquinomo. She will invest the loan in the purchase of essential ingredients to make these delicious Nicaraguan pastries. Ingredients such as corn, cheese, milk curd, sugar, eggs, cinnamon, etc.

loans.use: buy corn, cheese, milk curd, sugar, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Khar Yalla

texts.fr:
Madame Khar Yalla est une femme mariée âgée de 57 ans mère de 5 enfants et a 2 petits fils à sa charge.
Elle est membre du banc villageois depuis 02/12/2008 
khar Yalla pratique le commerce de légumes et de la friperie. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l'avoir pratiquée 22 ans.
Avec son nouveau crédit de 500000 francs CFA elle va acheter de la marchandise pré citée.
Les bénéfices générés par son activités lui permettront de payer la scolarité de ses enfants et de participer dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en: Mrs. Khar Yalla, age 57, is married and the mother of five children. She has two grandchildren to support. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois since December 2, 2008. She sells secondhand clothing and vegetables. She has a good experience in this field, since she's been running this business for 22 years. With her new XOF 500'000 loan, she will buy secondhand clothing and vegetables. Her profits will enable her to pay her children's school expenses, and help to cover the daily expenses of the family.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothing and vegetables

loans.name: Bok Dolle Liguey Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Bok Dollé Liguey a été crée le 20-12-2012. Il est composé de 12 femmes issues de la même localité.Leur activité principale est le commerce.		
Aminata (debout à droite de la photo)  est  responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 49 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants. 		
Avec son prêt reçu, elle va acheter des brebis et un bœuf qu'elle va engraisser et au bout six mois les revendre.		
Ses recettes lui permettront d'aider son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Solidarity Group Bok Dollé Liguey was established on December 20, 2012. It is made up of twelve women from the same village. Their main business is retail

Aminata (standing on the right in the photograph) is responsible for the group. She's 49 years old, married, and the mother of seven children.

With her loan, she will purchase one ewe and one ox to fatten and resell after six months.

Her profits will enable her to help her husband take care of the family's needs.

loans.use: to buy one ewe and one ox

loans.name: Ida Flor

texts.es:
Ida  tiene 27 años de edad, soltera y sin hijos a cargo, actualmente se encuentra viviendo en casa de sus padres.  
La casa en la que vive esta ubicada en una zona rural de nombre “Caserío Muy Finca Los Sernaque - Punto 4” perteneciente al distrito de Mochumi el cual esta ubicado a unos 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, es un caserío de aproximadamente unas 150 familias dedicas a actividades agrícolas y ganaderas netamente.

Ida se dedica de manera diaria a la crianza y posterior comercialización de ganado menor, en la actualidad cuenta con una gran cantidad de animales los cuales ha criado y engordado con gran esfuerzo, para lo que ha podido instalar en su propia casa espacios estratégicos para la crianza de los mismos, la relación que existe con sus padres y demás familiares es muy bueno debido a que le ha permitido aprender este negocio desde muy pequeña, en su deseo de mejor su calidad de vida es que ha hecho que emprendan en nuevos objetivos familiares y es que por eso trabajan diariamente para lograrlos.

Ida destinará el crédito para la compra de carneros para su  engorde y posterior comercialización en los mercados locales y aledaños a su caserío y además necesita acondicionar una parte de su casa donde dictará clases particulares aprovechando así la carrera técnica de profesora que sus padres lograron darle cuando eras mas joven, para lo que solicita un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 1500 Nuevos Soles. Dichas clases particulares que dicta suman un ingreso diario para el sustento del hogar y así de esa manera apoyar a sus padres.

Ida cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales por los vecinos que habitan en su caserío.
texts.en:
Ida, 27, is single and has no children.  Currently she is living in her parents' house.  The house she lives in is located in a rural area called “Caserío Muy Finca Los Sernaque - Punto 4," in the district of Mochumí, located some 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.  It is a very small village of approximately 150 families who work squarely in farming and ranching activities.

Ida works daily raising and later selling small animals.  Currently she has a large number of animals she has raised and fattened with great effort, for which she has set up in her own house strategic spaces for raising them.  Her relationship with her parents and other family members is very good because it has allowed her to learn this business since she was very young.  Her desire to improve her quality of life has made them undertake new family goals, and they work daily to achieve them.

Ida will use the loan to buy sheep to fatten and later sell in the local markets and those near her hamlet.  She also needs to renovate a part of her house where she will give private classes, making the most of the teaching career her parents managed to give her when she was younger.  This is why she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternative for a sum of 1500 PEN.  The private classes she teaches add a daily income for the support of the home and in this way she helps her parents.

Ida has good personal and work references from the neighbors who live in her village.

loans.use: to buy sheep to raise and later sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter still sells curios, and his business is doing well. He paid his previous loan well and in good time. 

He has applied for a second loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), which he intends to use to purchase materials for making more curio products for sale.

In the future, Peter hopes to sell curios on a large scale; this will increase his income.

loans.use: to buy curios for sale.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina, de 37 años, es una mujer soltera dedicada a su trabajo, vive en su propia casa que con gran esfuerzo logró obtener. Ella es una mujer muy perseverante se dedica al alquiler de locales para cualquier negocio. Hace 10 años empezó con esta actividad que con gran esfuerzo logró conseguir, ya que es  la forma de poder sobresalir adelante pensando en el futuro. Le gusta el negocio independientes, tanto que desea abrir una tienda de abarrotes para mas adelante; es por ello que acude a las oficinas de MFP, para solicitar un préstamo que ayude a lograr su objetivo de trabajo. Este será su crédito número 01 con MFP; lo cual ella está contenta de saber que contará que el apoyo financiero para lograr con sus planes de trabajo. En su banco comunal es una socia participe de las reuniones.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará productos de abarrotes como por ejemplo: detergentes, variedades de jabones,  arroz, azúcar, menestras y verduras entre otros para montar su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Josefina, 37, is a single woman who is dedicated to her work. She lives in her own house, which she was able to obtain only through great effort. She is a persevering woman who works renting out locations for any type of business. She started doing this work ten years ago and, with a great deal of effort, it has become a way to get ahead, with an eye to the future. Josefina enjoys independent businesses so much that she wants to open her own grocery store to get even further ahead. This is why she approached Microfinanzas Prisma to request a loan to help achieve her goal. This will be Josefina's first loan through MFP and she is very happy to know that she can count on this financial support to carry out her plans. She is a participating member at meetings of her communal bank.

Josefina will use this 1,000 nuevos soles to buy grocery products like: detergents, a variety of soaps, rice, sugar, stews, and vegetables, among other items for setting up her store.

loans.use: to buy detergents, a variety of soaps, rice, sugar, stews and vegetables

loans.name: Oyshajon

texts.ru: Ойшачон жительница города Худжанд. Возраст, 55 лет. Замужем. Имеет одного ребенка. Ойшачон более десяти лет занимается торговлей на рынке. Она арендует торговую точку, где продает фрукты. Кредит берет для покупки бананов, яблок, груши и лимонов.
texts.en: Oyshajon is a resident of the city of Khujand. She is 55 years old, married, and has one child.  She has been involved in sales at the market for more than then years.  She leases a retail outlet, where she sells fruits.  She is taking a loan to buy bananas, apples, pears and lemons.

loans.use: to buy fruits.

loans.name: Abdukahhor

texts.ru: Абдукаххор проживает в городе Худжанд. Ему 57 лет. Женат. Имеет двоих детей. Он предоставляет услугу такси. Этим видом деятельности занимается 12 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения автомобиля.
texts.en: Abdukahhor lives in the city of Khujand.  He is 57 years old, married, and has two children.  He provides a taxi service.  He has been involved in this activity for 12 years.  He is taking a loan to purchase a car.

loans.use: to purchase a car.

loans.name: Rahmon

texts.ru: Рахмон женат и любящий отец двоих детей. Он очень трудолюбивый и добрый человек. Более 8 лет он занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных и бахчевых культур. В основном он выращивает картофеля и лука. Имеет дехканское хозяйство. В бизнесе помогает жена.  Рахмон хотел бы получить займ в размере 1500 Сомони для покупки семян и минеральных удобрений. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Rahmon is married and the loving father of two children.  He is a very hardworking and kind man.  He has been involved in growing agricultural crops and melons for more than 8 years.  He mostly grows potatoes and onions.  He owns a dehkan farm.  His wife helps him with the business.  Rahmon would like to receive a loan in the amount of 1,500 somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers.  He is relying on your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a laptop which will help her access her coursework, do revision and acquire programming skills.

loans.name: Rachabgul

texts.ru: Рачабгул живет вместе с родителями и сестрой. Ее сестра занимается торговлей. В трудные дни ее сестра помогла ей заняться своим бизнесом. На сегодняшний она продолжает свою деятельность. Она берет кредит для покупки новых видов тканей.
texts.en: Rachabgul lives together with her parents and sister. Her sister does sales. During the difficult days her sister helped Rachabgul start her own business. At this time she continues doing it. She is taking out the loan to buy new kinds of fabrics.

loans.use: to buy new kinds of fabrics.

loans.name: Heyam

texts.en:
Heyam is a 56-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and a mother of three children.

Heyam sells clothing and is working from her home.

Heyam is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase more quantities of clothes to sell with an aspiration of improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for business purposes.

loans.name: Do'aa

texts.en:
Due to cultural issues Do’aa was not willing to have her picture uploaded on the internet, thus her husband is shown in the photo.

Do'aa is a 21-year-old lady from Marka, Amman, Jordan. She is selling clothes and she is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase more clothes to sell.

Do’aa is looking to increase her capital and to have her own shop.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for business purposes.

loans.name: Najwah

texts.en:
Due to cultural issues, Najwah is not willing to have her picture uploaded on the internet, thus the man in the photo is her son; Levon.

Najwah is a 50-year-old married woman from Marka, Amman; Jordan and a mother of four children. She sells accessories and she is requesting a loan of 800 JD to purchase more quantities.

Najwah is looking to expand her project and increase her customer base through participation in souk ayyadi bazaars – souk ayyadi is a free of charge service provided by Tamweelcom to its clients who have handmade products, offering them a marketing channel for their products.

loans.use: to purchase accessories for business purposes.

loans.name: Omaymah

texts.en:
Due to cultural issues, Omaymah is unwilling to have her picture uploaded on the internet, thus the man  in the photo is her son.

Omaymah is a 42-years-old married woman from Al Hussein, Amman, Jordan and a mother of three children.

Omaymah is looking to improve her family's living conditions thus she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to paint her house and do some maintenance since her son will get married soon and live in the same house.

Omaymah’s married sons are living with her in the same house and she is looking to help them have their own houses.

loans.use: to paint her house.

loans.name: Vera

texts.en:
Vera is a 59-year-old married woman from Al Salt, Al Balqa, Jordan.

Vera is making handmade pottery and ceramics and she is requesting a loan of 800 JD to purchase raw materials needed.

Vera is looking to expand her project and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials needed for making pottery and ceramics

loans.name: Karmah

texts.en:
Karmah is a 41-year-old married woman from Baqa'a, Jordan and a mother of seven children.

Karmah has a home-based project in which she sells cleaning products hand-in-hand with her husband who distributes them using his car so that they can both provide a better life for their family.

Also, Karmah is trading in small items that can be recycled such as plastics and sometimes bread.

Karmah is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase more cleaning products with an aspiration of expanding her project into a shop outside the home.

loans.use: to purchase new cleaning products for business purposes

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en:
Ashraf is a 25-year-old from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan.

Ashraf is about to get married and he is requesting a loan of 1500 JD to finance part of his wedding expenses.

loans.use: to finance part of his wedding expenses.

loans.name: Ohod

texts.en:
Ohod is unwilling to have her picture uploaded on the internet, thus the man in the photo is her husband, Maheeb.

Ohod is a 24-year-old married woman from Al Salt, Al Balqa’a, Jordan.

Ohod’s business started through selling shoes from home. Then with her hard work and a strong determination, she was able to have a shop for her business in which she repairs shoes in adittion to selling new ones. Now, Ohod is requesting a loan of 600 JD to purchase more shoes for business purposes.

Ohod looking to improve her house and provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase shoes for business purposes.

loans.name: Nonghin Group

texts.fr:
Mme ZOENABO est la représentante du groupe Nonghin. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 20ans et le moins âgé a 08ans. Tous  vont à l’école. Elle a 04 personnes en charge.

Elle vend de pagnes depuis 05ans. Celle qui est sortie est habillé en jaune et se trouve dans le cliché à l'angle. Elle s’approvisionne au marché du secteur 10 en ville. Ses clients sont les femmes, hommes.

Elle veut ajouter de l’argent pour s’acheter 02 balles de pagnes.

Mme avec ses économies contribue à l’épanouissement de son foyer et aider à la scolarisation de ses enfants. Elle ambitionne ouvrir une  grande boutique de pagnes.
texts.en: Mrs. ZOENABO is the representative of Nonghin Group. She is married and the mother of three children. The oldest is 20 and the youngest is 8 years old. All attend school.
