La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cuyes y gallinas al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "Siempre Juntos" (Always Together) community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

The member is Teresa.  She is 60 years old, married, and has five children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business raising animals such as guinea pigs and hens which she then sells herself.  She works from 8.00am to 5.00pm and, through this small business, she provides for her children.  Teresa's dream is to have a sales location from which to sell her animals.  She is requesting this loan to buy guinea pigs and hens wholesale.

Teresa is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and hens wholesale

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Altantsetseg, 38, lives with her two sons in Uvurhangai Province of Central Mongolia. Her husband lives in the capital city, and their oldest son studies at the high school. Altantsetseg has been running a home products retail business since 2009, offering good prices and quality merchandise that attract many customers. With sales up over the past last year, her business plan is to reduce costs by purchasing her goods at a discounted price from the capital city.

Now requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase those goods, Altantsetseg says, I would like to extend my business so that I can increase my income and save for my sons' tuition fees."

loans.use: to purchase more household goods for resale.

loans.name: Emprendedoras De Chilamate Group

texts.es:
Banco Mujer Emprendedoras de Chilamate
Comercio
700000
	El grupo tiene trabaja con Fundación Mujer desde el 2009, son de la zona de Poas, integrado  por 8 señoras, de estas 2 solicitan la renovación de su préstamo en esta oportunidad.

	Son un grupo de mujeres emprendedoras con la idea de recibir el apoyo económico de Fundación Mujer y mejorar los ingresos de sus hogares, además consolidar su grupo y ofrecer apoyo en su comunidad para que otras mujeres puedan crecer social y  económicamente. 

	Demuestran ser un grupo conocido y tienen experiencia en el trabajo en equipo y la solidaridad es parte importante de su trabajo. Manejan conceptos del trabajo en grupo y han desarrollado otras actividades complementarias para la generación de ingresos. Entre las actividades a desarrollar están las ventas de comidas y realización de rifas.

	  Un crédito se cancela este mes de Febrero y realizan la solicitud para renovarlo, Daniela de 29 años y madre de 3 hijos se dedica al arreglo de uñas y ventas por catálogo desde hace 3 años.  Este es su cuarto préstamo y ha demostrado una excelente conducta de pago y crecimiento tanto personal como económico. 

El grupo cuenta con activos para desarrollar sus actividades, los cuales se tomaron en conjunto para demostrar la solvencia de ellas. Ellas han establecido su plan de trabajo atendiendo tanto al hogar como a su negocio.

	Aparte del apoyo económico a sus actividades, tiene experiencia realizando actividades para generar dinero y crecer, se comprometen al trabajo en grupo para sacar adelante esta empresa y cumplir con las obligaciones adquiridas con este crédito.

	 Se va a apoyar esta actividad buscando su consolidación. Se cuenta con equipo y una clientela para los productos que ya se están comercializando. Son un grupo unido y han cumplido con los requisitos solicitados para la formación del Banco Mujer en lo que respecta al proceso de capacitación, demostrando compromiso y puntualidad.
texts.en:
Banco Mujer Emprendedoras de Chilamate (Entrepreneur Women’s Bank of Chilamate)

The communal bank has worked with Fundación Mujer since 2009. They are in the Poas area and made up of 8 women, two of whom ask for a renewal of their loan with this opportunity. 

They are a group of women entrepreneurs with the idea of receiving economic assistance from Fundación Mujer, of improving their household income, and of offering help in their community so that other women can grow socially and economically. 

They show themselves to be a well-known group, and they have experience in work and equipment as well as solidarity which is an important part of their work. They maintain work ethic in the group, and they have developed other complimentary activities in order to generate income. Among the development activities are food sales and raffle sales. 

One members of the group paid off her loan this February and made a request to renew. Her name is Daniela, 29 years old, who is a mother of 3 and works doing nails and catalogue sales. This is her fourth loan, and she has demonstrated an excellent payment record as well as personal and economic growth. 

The group has assets in order to develop their business activities which they took from themselves in order to demonstrate solvency. They have established their business plan, tending to their home as well as their business. 

Apart from the economic help for their business, the communal bank has experience doing things to generate money and to grow. They commit themselves to work as a team in order to move this enterprise forward and to comply with the obligations agreed to with this loan. 

The communal bank will support these business activities, seeking to consolidate and support other member in maintaining their business. The communal bank has equipment and a customer base for the products that they are already selling. They are a united group, and they have complied with the requested loan terms for the formation of the Banco Mujer in respect to the training process, demonstrating commitment and punctuality.

loans.use: to buy lingerie and to do catalog sales of items for food packaging.

loans.name: Elida

texts.es: Elida, de 50 años, es una mujer buena y amable, esta separada de su esposo, pero tiene un hijo de 32 años y juntos viene en su casa propia. El trabajo de Elida, consiste en la venta de ganchos, utensilios, herramientas, pomadas y otras cosas de uso personal de manera ambulante. Lleva realizando su trabajo por 10 años y durante éste  tiempo aprendió a vender y ganar clientes. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que tiene tiempo suficiente para no descuidar su hogar y puede realizar algunas tareas, además percibe ingresos. Debido a que sus clientes aumentan cada día, le da las esperanzas de tener un local propio para continuar con sus ventas y así evitaría el estar caminando. Este será el crédito número 13 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su negocio, por su parte se compromete una vez mas en seguir siendo una socia cumplida en el pago de sus cuotas. Está muy contenta de trabajar junto a los de su banco comunal ya que todos son muy solidarios y muy responsables. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 soles, comprará mercadería para aumentar la variedad de productos que ofrece a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Elida, 50, is a good and cheerful woman who is separated from her husband, but lives with her 32-year old son in their own house.  Her business is selling hangers, tools, hardware, creams, and other items of personal use as a street merchant.  She has been doing this work for 10 years and during this time she has learned how to sell and to attract customers.  She really likes her work since it leaves her time to care for her house and she can do other things besides making this income.  Because her customer base increases every day, she has hopes to have her own stand where she can continue her sales without doing all the walking.  This loan is number 13 with MFP and she is very happy to know that she will have the financial support since this will help her advance in her business.  She again promises to make all the payments on time as a good member.  She is satisfied to work together with the communal bank since the members are all responsible and supportive.  She will use the 1500 sols to buy merchandise to increase the variety of products that she offers her customers.
.

loans.use: to buy more hangers, hairbands, wallets and personal items

loans.name: Munhbat

texts.en:
Munhbat, a 35-year-old father of three children, all studying at the secondary school level, lives in Western Mongolia where he started working as a carpenter in 2004. During these years, he earned many regular customers making a variety of house furniture which his wife sells in the market. His plan is to make furniture in increasing quantities.

A diligent man who says, "I would like to extend my wooden furniture business by purchasing necessary materials so that there will be ready products for the customers to buy immediately instead of having to wait, Munhbat is requesting a loan of 1,700,000 MNT to purchase wood and other materials.

loans.use: to purchase wood and other materials for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase ink cartridges.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en: Rogelio is a married man having two children. Rogelio is 27 years old, residing at Inroad, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Rogelio owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting coconut for sale to earn a living. He has been 5 years in this business. Each month, he earns 7,000 PHP doing this type of work. He requested a loan of 40,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Rogelio has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, Rogelio wants to purchase an additional motorcycle.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE JUNTOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Gerardo; el tiene 59 años de edad y es casado y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de fabrica y venta de colchones, el socio tiene un local donde vende los colchones desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar el local de venta de colchones. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar colchones y también materiales para hacer los colchones como espuma y telas al por mayor.

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Gerardo is a member of the “SIEMPRE JUNTOS” [“Always Together”] communal bank.  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which is part of the province and the department of Cusco.

Gerardo is 59 years old, is married, and has 3 children.  He alternates his daily activities with his mattress making and selling business.  He has a shop where he sells mattresses from 9:00 AM until 6:00 PM.  This business is how he supports his children, and he wants to enlarge his mattress shop.  Gerardo is asking for a loan so he can purchase mattresses along with wholesale materials for making mattresses, such as foam and cloth.
  
Gerardo is happy about the loan and promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase mattresses along with wholesale materials for making mattresses.

loans.name: Henry

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE JUNTOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Henry; el tiene 39 años de edad y es soltero y tiene 1 hijo; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artículos de ferretería y perfumería como perfumes,colonias,clavos,martillos entre otras cosas, el socio trabaja en forma ambulatoria desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a su hijo, el sueño del socio es tener un local donde pueda vender los artículos de perfumería y ferretería. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar perfumes, colonias, clavos, fierros y herramientas para su negocio.

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower belongs to the "Siempre Juntos" communal bank, located in Cusco district, which is part of the province and department of Cusco.

The borrower's name is Henry. He is 39, single, and has one child.  He alternates his daily activities with his business selling hardware and perfume items, such as perfumes, colognes, nails, hammers, and other things 

He works as a street vendor from 8:00am to 6:00pm, and by means of this business he is raising his child. His dream is to have a shop where he can sell perfume and hardware items.

The borrower is applying for the loan to buy perfumes, colognes, nails, metal goods, and tools for his business.

Henry is happy to receive the loan, and promises to make his installment payments.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, colognes, nails, metal items, and tools for his business.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is a married woman. She has 4 children. Mariam operates a rental house business. She's worked in this business for 6 years. Her primary customers are the local area residents. She describes her greatest business challenge to be tenants not paying their rent on time and her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Mariam will use the 40,000 KES loan to purchase ceiling boards and paint to renovate her rental house. Mariam aspires to build another rental house in the future. She joined Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ceiling boards and paint to renovate her rental house.

loans.name: Sikukuu

texts.en: Sikukuu is a married woman. She has 4 children and all are enrolled in school. Sikukuu operates a firewood business and sells her goods from home. She's worked in this business for 4 years. Her primary customers are her neighbors and passersby. Sikukuu's other source of income includes selling Lesos (kanga). She describes her greatest business challenges to be seasonality and insecurity. Her highest monthly expenses are food and school fees. She owns a house that has both electricity and piped water. Sikukuu will use the 20,000 KES loan to purchase more stocks of firewood for resale. Sikukuu aspires to establish a boutique in the future. She joined Yehu because it offers quality financial services.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of firewood for resale.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en: Mwanakombo is a married woman. She has 1 child. Mwanakombo operates a charcoal selling business and sells her goods from home. She's worked in this business for 6 months. Her primary customers are her neighbors and passersby. She describes her greatest business challenges to be seasonality and insecurity. Her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Mwanakombo will use the 20,000 KES loan to purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale. Mwanakombo aspires to expand her business in the future. She joined Yehu because it offers quality financial services.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María, siempre se dedica a la elaboración de loza, vive con esposo, una hija y cuatro nietos, Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales para la elaboración de ollas, comales, sartenes, como nacazcol,  barro, leña, con este préstamo obtendrá lo necesario para elaborar muchos más productos.
Este es su segundo prestamo en Kiva, ha sido una buena cliente, que desea superarse con la ayuda de estos prestamos.
texts.en:
María has always worked making crockery. She lives with her husband, a daughter, and four grandchildren. She is applying for a loan to buy materials for making pots, comals (griddles) and saucepans, such as nacazcol (a type of pigment), clay and firewood. With this loan she will get what she needs to make many more products. 

This is her second loan. She has been a good client to date and is hoping to get ahead with the help of these loans.

loans.use: To buy nacazcol (a type of pigment), clay, and firewood.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 34-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has seven children between the ages of 5 and 17, five of whom go to school. 

Mary runs a food store business, and she has been in this business for four years. She has no employees. Mary heard about Finance Sudan through fellow clients, as well as outreach and promotion done by the loan officers. 

She is taking a loan of 1,500 SDG to purchase more food items like cooking oil, beans, Chuckles (candy), and many other items. Mary has no other source of income in addition to this business.

In five years’ time Mary would like to have increments in the business size and to have a good store. Her major challenges include a low income rate and school fees. 

Mary says that she is happy about Finance Sudan’s program in South Sudan, especially for women.

loans.use: to purchase more food items like cooking oil, beans, Chuckles (candy), and many other items.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE JUNTOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marcelina; ella tiene 33 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo en un veterinaria como asistente la socia trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este trabajo la socia quiere salir adelante. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar unos artefactos para su casa como televisor y radio. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Marcelina is a member of the “SIEMPRE JUNTOS” [“Always Together”] communal bank.  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which is part of the province and department of Cusco.

Marcelina is 33 years old and single.  She alternates her daily activities with her job as a veterinarian’s assistant.  She works from 9:00 AM until 7:00 PM, and she wants to get ahead through her work.  Marcelina is asking for a loan so she can purchase some appliances for her home, such as a television and radio.

Marcelina is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase appliances for her home.

loans.name: Dea Argetina

texts.es:
Argentina es una mujer de 30 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de ropa. 

Su historia comenzó cuando se separo del esposo tuvo la necesidad de comenzar un negocio y lo hizo con la venta de ropa, sus dificultades es el sector y sus hijos pues no le gusta dejarlos solos, está separada del esposo, si tiene 2 hijos estudian en escuela particular.

Su sueño es mejorar su calidad de vida para darles los estudios a sus hijos. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su negocio de ventas de ropa comprar ropa para mujeres y hombres.
texts.en:
Argentina is a 30 year old woman who has many aspirations for the success of her clothes selling business in the coming years.

Her story began when she separated from her husband and needed to start a business. She decided to sell clothes.  She finds that the sector is a difficult one and she does not like to leave her children alone. As noted, she is separated from her husband and has two children who are attending  a private school. 

Her dream is to improve her quality of life and to provide an education for her children. Consequently she would like a loan to buy women's and men’s garments for her clothes selling business

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Evaristo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE JUNTOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Evaristo; el tiene 46 años de edad y es soltero y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo como maestro de obras, el realiza diferentes tipos de construcción, arreglos de techos y también pinturas de casas, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m, por medio de este trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar herramientas para su trabajo como pinturas, clavos y fierros.

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Evaristo is a member of the “SIEMPRE JUNTOS” [“Always Together”] communal bank.  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which is part of the province and the department of Cusco.

Evaristo is 46 years old, is single, and has 3 children.  He alternates his daily activities with his job as a construction foreman.  He does different kinds of construction work, including repairing roofs and painting houses.  He works from 8:00 AM until 4:00 PM, and his work is how he supports his children.  Evaristo is asking for a loan so he can purchase supplies for his job such as paint, nails, and rebar.
   
Evaristo is happy about the loan and promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for his job such as paint, nails, and rebar.

loans.name: Jaklin

texts.es: Jaklin, de 28 años, es una mujer amable, buena y emprendedora, es madre de Adriana de 4 años a quien cría desde hace tres años. Se separo de su pareja y ahora tiene que asumir la crianza de su menor hija ella sola. Juntas viven en su casa propia y a diario trabaja mucho para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su hija. A diario, Jaklin sale en busca de sus clientes, transita mucho por toda la ciudad debido a que tiene que visitar a sus amigos, familiares y vecinos. Su negocio consiste en la venta de zapatos, sandalias, zapatillas y otros, tiene dos formas de venderlos, al contado o al crédito. El precio varia dependiendo del tiempo y la modalidad que desee el cliente adquirirlos. Lleva realizando su trabajo por 2 años y trabaja sola. Le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que le permite disponer de su tiempo,  además de mejorar sus ingresos a través de sus ventas. Durante el tiempo que está haciendo su trabajo, aprendió mucho sobre sus clientes, es por eso que los trata muy bien y siempre les brinda una sonrrisa. Tiene muchos planes a futuro, pero lo que mas desea es consolidar su negocio y mas adelante tener un local en donde pueda atender a sus clientes con mayor comodidad. Este será el crédito número 3 con MFP, por ellos espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes, por otro lado se compromete una vez mas en cumplir con el pago de cuotas. Con el monto solicitado de 2,000 soles, comprará más calzados, ya que desea empezar a ofrecer calzados para niños y caballeros, esto le permitirá mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
28-year-old Jaklin is a kind, enterprising woman and mother to 4-year-old Adriana. Jaklin has raised her daughter alone for three years, since she separated from her partner. They live together in their own home and she works hard everyday to provide a better quality of life for her daughter. 

Every day, Jaklin searches for customers and travels extensively throughout the city because she has to visit friends, relatives and neighbors. She has a business selling shoes, sandals, and slippers, among others. She sells for both cash or credit, and the price of the product varies according to the time and manner the customer wishes to buy them. She has had this business for 2 years, and works alone. 

Jaklin enjoys her work because it allows her to make use of her time, and improve her income through sales. Since she has been working in this job, she has learned a lot about her customers which is why she treats them very well and makes them smile. Jaklin has many future plans, but what she most desires is to consolidate her business and be able to have a premises where she can serve her customers with greater convenience. 

This will be Jaklin's third loan with MFP, and hopes for their collaboration so she can achieve her goals. She agrees to comply with the payment schedule. With the requested amount of 2.000 soles, she will invest in more shoes because she wants to start offering footwear for children and gentlemen, which will help her to improve her sales.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes for children and gentlemen

loans.name: Estela Amparito

texts.es:
Estela es una mujer de 39 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de Avon y omnilife. 

Su historia comenzó cuando necesitaba un trabajo que le permita estar más tiempo en casa y una amiga le invito a inscribirse primero en Avon y después en omnilife, trabaja en las tardes visita a su familia y ofrece sus productos, las dificultades son los ladrones después que compra producto, está casada el esposo es maestro albañil, si tiene hijos todos son mayores. 

Su sueño es poner un negocio en su casa como un restaurant. Por eso quiere el préstamo para perfumes, cremas y cosmeticos para su negocio.
texts.en:
Estela is a 39 year old woman who has many aspirations for the success of her business selling Avon and Omnilife in the coming years.

Her story began when she needed a job that would enable her to spend more time at home and a friend invited her to enroll first in Avon and later in Omnilife. She works in the afternoons, visiting her family and selling her products. Difficulties include thieves who do not pay for their products. She is married and her husband is a master bricklayer. She has children and all are adults.

Her dream is to also install a business in her home like a restaurant. Consequently, she would like a loan to buy perfume, face cream and cosmetics for her business.

loans.use: to buy perfume, face cream and cosmetics.

loans.name: Rigoberto Linder

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE JUNTOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Rigoberto Linder; el tiene 31 años de edad y es soltero; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo como policía, el socio trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, por medio de este trabajo el socio quiere salir adelante. El  socio solicita el préstamo para uso personal para comprar un televisor para su casa.
 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member, Rigoberto, belongs to the community bank "SIEMPRE JUNTOS" (Together Forever). The bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco.

Rigoberto is 31 years old and unmarried. His daily activities include his work as a policeman from 6:00 am to 10:00 pm. His goal is to succeed in life through his work. Rigoberto is seeking a personal use loan to buy a TV for his home.
  
The partner is grateful for the loan and agrees to comply with the payment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase a TV for his home, with a personal loan.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE JUNTOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Mariela; ella tiene 27 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo como dentista, ella tiene un consultorio dental donde trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este trabajo la socia saca adelante s su hijos, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su consultorio dental. La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su consultorio dental.
 
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member, Mariela, belongs to the communal bank "SIEMPRE JUNTOS" (Together Forever). The bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco.

Mariela is 27 years old. She is single and has one son. She is a dentist, and has her own dental practice where she works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. Through her work, she is able to raise her family and her dream is to expand her practice. Mariela is requesting this loan to operate her dental practice.
 
The member is thankful for the loan and agrees to meet the payment schedule.

loans.use: to manage her dental practice

loans.name: Ana Marcela

texts.es: Ana Marcela es una joven emprendedora que toda la vida ha luchado por salir adelante, emprende su negocio de la venta de mercadería en general, ella ya tiene años de experiencia en el negocio y sus clientes la visitan a su casa de habitación y además da los servicios a domicilios. Ana Marcela está solicitando financiamiento para la compra de mercadería en general como blusas, ropa, camisas, sandalias, pantalones entre otros productos que sus clientes le solicitan.
texts.en: Ana Marcela is an enterprising young woman who has struggled her whole life to get ahead.  She has a business selling general merchandise, and already has years of experience in this business.  Her customers come to her home where her business is located, and she also provides a home delivery service.  Ana Marcela is asking for a loan so she can purchase merchandise such as blouses, shirts, sandals, pants, other items of clothing, and other products that her customers are requesting.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, shirts, sandals, pants, and other products.

loans.name: Jocotal Group

texts.es:
El grupo lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ella es María Lucrecia quien tiene una pulpería. Este negocio lo inicio hace 17 años con la venta de verduras desde yuca, pipian, ayote, chayote…etc. Ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos mayores de edad.
Su meta es salir adelante y mejorar su negocio lo cual ha logrado poco a poco con el ultimo crédito con las ganancias condicionar los estantes y vitrinas.
Las otras integrantes son Neli Susana de 35 años quien vende cosméticos y perfumes, y Lila de  25 años se dedica al comercio de ropa desde hace 3 años.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three hard-working and entrepreneurial people.  One of them is María Lucrecia who owns a grocery store.  She started her business 17 years ago, selling vegetables such as sweet potatoes, 'ayote', 'pipian' (types of squash) and 'chayote' (vegetable pears).  She is married and has four adult children.

María's goal is to make progress and improve her business, something she has gradually managed with her previous loans, using the profits to fix up her shelving and display cabinets.  The other members of this group are 35-year-old Neli Susana, who sells cosmetics and perfumes, and 25-year-old Lila, who has been selling clothes for three years.

loans.use: to buy basic grains and other products to increase her business.

loans.name: Sabrina Group

texts.es:
El grupo Sabrina esta integrado por tres feminas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Ruth Ileana de 31 años quien acaba de iniciar con la venta de comida negocio al cual invertirá el  crédito. Ella inicio con la venta de ropa y cosméticos pero este fue de cayendo  y es por ello que decidió probar con otro negocio.
Las otras integrantes son Elena de 56 años quien vende ropa y comida y Maribel del Carmen tiene una pulpería hace 11 años.
texts.en:
The Sabrina group is composed by hardworking and resourceful women. One of them is Ruth Ilena, aged 31, who has just started a food selling activity in which she will invest her loan. She has started working by selling clothes and cosmetics, but since this activity was in decline she decided to try her hand at another field. 
The other members of the group are Elena, aged 56, who sells clothes and food, and Maribel del Carmen, who has been running a corner shop for 11 years.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, meat and perishable goods.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Madoma Group

texts.es:
El grupo madoma lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras, emprendedoras y joviales una de ellas es Luz Marina de 55 años quien se dedica a la venta de comida. Este negocio lo inicio hace 11 años con la venta de verduras luego empezo a realizar sopas y vaho el cual poco a poco fue creciendo. Su meta es tener un restaurante con todas las condiciones.
Las otras integrantes son Mayra de 59 años quien se dedica al comercio de ropa, zapatos y trajes de baile de fantasía y eróticos y Hiondra a Isabel quien vende ropa y trajes de fantasía.

La foto fue tomada en la capacitacion de Educación Financiera la cual se esta empezando a dar en cada desembolso.
texts.en:
The Madoma group consists of three women who are hard-working, entrepreneurial, and cheerful. One of them is Luz Marina, who is 55 years old and sells food. She began this business 11 years ago selling vegetables, then she began to make soups and vaho (a Nicaraguan dish made of beef, plantains, and yucca steamed in banana leaves), and her business grew little by little. Her goal is to have a fully-equipped restaurant.

The other members are Mayra, who is 59 and sells clothing, shoes, and fancy, erotic dance costumes, and Hiomda Isabel, who sells clothing and fancy dresses.

The photo was taken at the Financial Education training session, which is beginning to be given at each loan disbursement.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, meat, sodas, and other products.

loans.name: Fidelina Yolanda

texts.es:
Fidelina es una mujer de 36 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su mini tienda de víveres.

Su historia comenzó cuando empezó con una pequeña venta de colas y golosinas; después puso una tienda y poco a poco la fue surtiendo que tiene 1 año, su trabajo lo hace con sus hijos desde las 6:00AM hasta las 11.00, sus dificultades son la delincuencia está separada actualmente, tiene 1 hijo de 10 años que estudia en una escuela fiscal.

Su meta es sacar adelante a su hijo economicamente. Por eso quiere el préstamo para invertir en su tienda de víveres comprando arroz, legumbres, bebidas, verduras etc.
texts.en:
Fidelina is 36 years old, and she has many aspirations to make her small grocery store prosper over the coming years. 

Fidelina's story began when she started a small stall selling colas and candies. She then set up a shop, and over the first year it gradually became well stocked. She works there with her children from 6:00 to 11.00. Her difficulties with delinquent crime in her shop have now passed. She has a 10-year-old son who attends a government school.

Her goal is to be able to support her son financially. Fidelina requested this loan to invest in her grocery store. She will buy rice, vegetables, beverages, fruits, etc.

loans.use: to supply her store with rice, vegetables, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Tural

texts.ru: Turalu 20 let, on jenat, detey ne imeet i smotrit za bolnoy materyu. On zanat skotovodstvom, eto delo emu dostalos v nasledstvo ot otca i on zanimetsa etim uje 2 goda. On razvodit skot I prodaet masyo na bazare. Krome etogo Tural rabotaet masterom po remontu domov. On xochet vilechit mat’ I ego plani na budushee eto rasshirit biznes, postroit stoylo dla jivotnix I kupit 8 korov chtobi nachat biznes po prodaju molochnix produktov. Emu nujni dengi v summe 800 AZN dla remonta sobstvennogo doma, on xochet kupit  pilomaterialov kamni. Tural ne xochet prodavat dla etogo dela korovu tak kak ot etogo mojet postradat ego delo.
texts.en:
Tural is 20 years old. He is married, has no children, and takes care of his sick mother. Tural raises livestock - a business he inherited from his father two years ago. He raises animals and then sells their meat at the market. In addition, Tural performs home repairs. He would like to provide medical treatment to his mother, and also has plans to expand his business, build stables for his animals, and buy 8 cows in order to start a new business selling dairy products. 

Tural needs a sum of 800 AZN to buy lumber and masonry to repair his home. He does not want to sell a cow to finance this, as doing so may harm his business.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to repair his house

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en: Mwanasiti is a married woman with two children. She operates a juice (soft drink) business and sells her products from home. She has worked in this business for three years. Her primary customers are her neighbors and passersby. She describes her greatest business challenge as seasonality and her highest monthly expense as food. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Mwanasiti will use the Kes 40,000 loan to purchase another freezer for her business. Mwanasiti aspires to establish a hotel in the future. She joined Yehu because it offers quality financial services.

loans.use: To purchase another freezer for her business.

loans.name: Carloma

texts.en:
Carloma is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 
Carloma has a shop where she makes and sells snacks like rice and pancakes. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 to buy raw ingredients.
Carloma is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Carloma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 
Carmelita has a bakeshop where she sells breads, pastries and biscuits. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients needed for the bakeshop.
Carmelita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Carmelita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for the bakeshop.

loans.name: Juliana Ricarda

texts.es:
La señora Juliana es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 59 años quien se dedica a la venta de cosméticos desde hace mas de 10 años. Este negocio lo inicio vendiendo en su casas pequeñas cantidades y realizaba camisas, cortinas…etc. Pero con ayuda de sus hijos quienes viven fuera del país ideo empezar a viajar y vender cosméticos en Siuna.
Ella es casada y tiene 5 hijos ya todos mayores quienes le ayudan económicamente. Su meta es ahorrar para poner un negocio en su casa para cuando llegue su vejes y tenga que retirarse por no poder seguir viajando.
texts.en:
Juliana is a hardworking and enterprising woman of 59 years old who has been working in cosmetic sales for more than 10 years. She began this business selling from home in little quantities and she made shirts and curtains, and other items. But with the help of her children who live outside the country she had the vision of beginning to travel and sell cosmetics in Siuna.

She is married and has 5 children who are all adults helping her financially. Her goal is to save in order to put a business in her home so that when she reaches old age she can retire and not have to continue traveling.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Фотима замужем и любящая мать троих детей. Она очень трудолюбивая и добросовестная женщина. Муж работает в Российской Федерации строителем. Она открыла свой бизнес в 2002 году и до сегодняшнего времени продолжает свой бизнес. Она занимается купле- продажей одеял и покрывал на рынке. Начала бизнес  собственным капиталом. Она старается расширить свой бизнес, чтобы содержать свою семью в хороших условиях жизни. Фотима хотела бы получить займ в размере 3000$ США для покупки товара с целью расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Fotima is married and a loving mother of three children. She is a very hard-working and conscientious woman. Her husband works in Russia as a construction worker. Fotima opened her business in 2002 and has continued it since, selling blankets and bed covers at the market. She started her business with her own money and has been trying to expand it in order to provide good living conditions for her family. Fotima would like to receive a loan of $3000 to purchase new merchandise and grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase new merchandise

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en: Leonard is a 58-year-old married man. He has six children with ages ranging from five to 21. He describes himself to be optimistic. He operates a retail store where he repairs and sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a strategic area and his customers are both regulars and walk-ins. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving his store. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase another sewing machine. Leonard's business goal is to be a supplier of clothes to major towns within five years.

loans.use: to buy another sewing machine.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 48 years old and married with two children in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Cecilia has a fruit and vegetable business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy more fruit and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

She has been in this business for 15 years. Cecilia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu is applying for another loan to expand her charcoal and coconut-selling business. She will use this 50,000 Kes loan to purchase more sacks of charcoal and coconuts for resale. In the future, Mwanatumu aspires to continue improving her business. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Mwanatumu has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of charcoal and coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. 
Antonio has a shop where he makes and sells coconut wines and vinegars. He has had this business for five years. He has requested a loan for 3,000 PHP to buy the raw materials needed for making coconut wine.
Antonio is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Antonio hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials needed for making coconut wine.

loans.name: Anna Sol

texts.en:
Anna Sol is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with one child. 
Anna Sol has a retail shop where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy more stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Anna Sol is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Anna Sol hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for sale.

loans.name: Holger Ivan

texts.es:
Holger es un hombre de 29 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su taller mecánico. 

Su historia empezó cuando inicio como ayudante, luego emprendí mi propio taller, su trabajo lo hace con un colega que es mi oficial, sus dificultades son algunas veces el clima y la lluvia, está soltero, no por el momento.

Su sueño es tener un negocio con todos las cualidades necesarias. Por eso quiere el préstamo para invertir en un negocio comprando herramientas y tubos de llantas para mejorar su servicio.
texts.en:
Holger is 29 years old and really hopes that his mechanic’s shop will be successful in the next few years.  

Holger began his career as an assistant and later set up his own shop.  He now works with a colleague who is a skilled worker.  His main difficulties are the weather and the rain at times.  Holger is single at the moment.

Holger’s goal is to have a business that has everything he needs.  He wants to use the loan to purchase tools and inner tubes so he can improve his service.

loans.use: to purchase tools and inner tubes.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 
Liza has a retail shop where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy more of stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Liza is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Liza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Elvira works hard to support her family.

She sells bags and clothing in the Philippines, and earns additional income from tricycle transport. Elvira is borrowing PHP 14,500 through NWTF to buy additional stock of bags and ready-to-wear clothing.

Elvira has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to buy an additional tricycle to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of bags and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: This time, Emma is borrowing Php 21,000 to fund her general store business. The general store business that she previously funded through NWTF and KIVA continues to provide Emma and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a married woman. She has two children, one year old and three years old. She describes herself as an ambitious woman. She operates a beauty salon where she provides services such as plaiting, manicure, pedicure, blow-dry, etc. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located at a strategic area and her customers are frequent and many are walk-ins. 

Mercy describes her biggest business challenges to be the high price of rent for the room of operation and the electricity bill. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase  more beauty products such as hair oil, Cutex, etc. Mercy's  business goal is to run another beauty salon  within five years.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products such as hair oil, Cutex, etc.

loans.name: Ines

texts.en:
Ines is 56 years old and a widow with two children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ines is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Ines has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from tricycle (three-wheeled) transport.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Linila

texts.en:
Linila is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Linila is providing "motorela" or motorcycle services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the service.

Linila is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Linila hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the service

loans.name: Irenea

texts.en:
Irenea is 58 years old and a widow with four children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Irenea is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Irenea has been raising pigs  for six years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Leslier

texts.es:
Leslier es un padre de familia muy responsable 41 años de edad, es viudo y vive en  casa propia con su menor hijo la cual ha sido construida en base a su trabajo, vive en un caserío rural de nombre “Nueva Arica” ubicado a unos a unas 2 horas de la provincia de Chiclayo. Los pobladores de la zona en la que vive se dedican netamente a la agricultura, ganadería, artesanía entre otros, son caseríos rurales que están en vías de su desarrollo por lo que solo cuentan con el servicio básico de energía eléctrica.


Leslier se dedica de manera diaria a la crianza y posterior comercialización de animales menores como: patos, pavos, gallinas entre otros, actividad a la que se ha dedicado 11 años aproximadamente, los conocimientos sobre el negocio han sido heredados de sus padres, para lo que podido instalar en su propia casa espacios estratégicos para la crianza de los mismos, adicionalmente también se genera otros ingresos diarios dedicándose a trabajar de jornalero en diferentes fundos de la ciudad. 
Leslier, desde muy pequeño se dedicado a trabajar en el campo debido a que sus padres siempre han sido agricultores, ahora ya con una familia se ha decidido a seguir creciendo con su negocio con la finalidad de darles una mejor educación a sus hijos y por ende una mejor calidad de vida.

Y por sus mismos deseos de salir adelante es que Leslier ha decidido solicitar un crédito en Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 2000 Nuevos Soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para sus animales hasta que alcancen el tamaño y peso ideal para su venta.
texts.en:
Leslier is a very responsible father of a family. He is 41 years old and a widower. He lives with his young son in his own house, which was constructed on the basis of his labor. He lives in a rural village called Nueva Arica, which is located about 2 hours from the province of Chiclayo. The residents of the area in which he lives work totally in agriculture, livestock-raising, and handicrafts, among others. These are rural villages which are in the process of their development, so they only have basic electrical service.

Leslier works daily to raise and later sell small animals such as ducks, turkeys, and hens, among others. He has done this work for approximately 11 years. He received his knowledge about the business from his parents, so he was able to set up strategic spaces for raising these animals at his own house. In addition, he also generates other daily income by working as a day laborer at various city properties.

Since he was very young, Leslier worked in the fields, since his parents were always farmers. Now, with a family, he has decided to continue growing his business with the goal of giving a better education to his sons and therefore a better quality of life.

Because of his own desire to advance, Leslier has decided to apply to Edpyme Alternative for a loan in the amount of 2000 PEN for the purchase of balanced feed for his animals until they reach the ideal size and weight for sale.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for his animals

loans.name: Sofig

texts.ru: Sofig jenat i u nego chetvero detey. On vedet fermerskoe xozaystvo I zanimaetsa skotovodstvom. On vladeet magazinom gde prodayet moloko, sir, pshenicu, yachmen I drugie tovari povsednegnogo sprosa.  U nego odin pomoshnik na rabote, Sofig planiruet rasshirit fermerskoe xozaytvo I uveren chto s razvitiem svoego biznesa otkroyutsa novie rabochie mesta I tak on smojet pomogat ludam. Na segodnashniy den u nego est 1 korova I 2 bika.   Sofig xochet vzat v kredit 1500 azn chtobi postroit vannuyu u seba doma, sozdat udobstva dla semyi. On chestniy I pravilniy v svoix deystviyax chelovek. On nadeetsa na pomosh i zarane blagodarit za eto.
texts.en: Sofig is married and has four children. He runs a farming business and also does animal husbandry. He owns a store where he sells milk, cheese, wheat, barley and other products for daily consumption. He has one helper at the store. Sofig plans to expand the farming business and is confident that with the growth of his own business new job positions will open so this way he can help people. Today he has one cow and two bulls. Sofig wants to take out a loan in the amount of 1,500 AZN to build a bathroom at his home and create comfortable conditions for his family. He is honest and a man of proper actions. He hopes for your help and is thanking in advance for the loan.

loans.use: to build a bathroom at home.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a natural medicines business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell for her natural medicines business.

Concepcion has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from clothing sales.

Concepcion has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to build a house for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell to customers.

loans.name: Jemina

texts.en:
Jemina is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Jemina has a retail shop where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Jemina is  a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Jemina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Jesil

texts.en:
Jesil is 39 years old and married with three children. Jesil works very hard to provide for them.

Jesil runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Jesil has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, snack foods and other miscellaneous goods. 

Jesil would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family and do some house improvement.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 36 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like shampoo, soap and groceries.

Jocelyn has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from her Natasha and Avon dealership.

Jocelyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like shampoo, soap and groceries.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is  a farmer in Kitale where she lives with her family of three children aged between 18 and 8 years and all schooling.She has been in mixed farming for seven years and says it's through farming that she  provides her family with their daily basic needs.

Florence has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds. She says this expansion and diversification  of her farming business will give her family both food and financial security. She adds the eggs produced will form part of family meals and provide income to meet other needs.

She is focused on repaying the loan in order to acquire more in future. She however notes animal diseases are a constant challenge to farmers.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Galo Vidal

texts.es:
Galo es un hombre que tiene 47 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los años próximos de prosperar en su pequeña venta de carne. 

Su historia empezó cuando su papa se dedicaba a la venta de carne, entonces el decidió poner su propio negocio su trabajo lo hace en todas las mañanas con su hijo sus dificultades es el transporte de la carne no está casado, el es divorciado, si tiene hijos todos son mayores de edad. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones como mejorar su casa para poner su propio negocio en la propia casa. Por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar una maquina cortadora para la venta de carne como chorizos, pollos, res etc.
texts.en:
Galo is a 47-year-old man who has many aspirations to prosper in the coming years in his little meat-selling business.

Its history began when his father worked selling meat, then he decided to set up his own business. He does his work every morning with his son. His difficulty is the transport of the meat. He is not married, he is divorced. He has children, all adults.

He has many aspirations to improve his house so that he can set up his own business at his house. For this reason, he needs a loan to buy a cutting machine so that he can sell meat such as sausages, chicken, beef, etc.

loans.use: to buy a meat-cutting machine

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Ligaya works hard to support her family.

She has a dry goods business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Ligaya is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more dry goods to sell.

Ligaya has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 43 years old and married with three children. With one child in school, Leonila works very hard to provide for her family.

Leonila runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Leonila has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods and other groceries. 

In the future Leonila would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is aged 43 and has been in active farming in her rural home of Kitale in Western Kenya for over 25 years. Her farm currently supplies the local market with milk, maize and beans, giving the family their basic requirements with the income realized. She currently employs one farmhand.

Elizabeth has requested a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says this will boost her farming income and enable her family to have better living standards. She emphasizes the increased number of her dairy cows  will also help provide bio-gas which will significantly reduce their fuel expenditure.
 
She however notes that poor infrastructure and animal diseases remain their daunting challenge. She is still optimistic business will grow and provide better living standards for the family.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a 38-year-old married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 4 years to 17 years. He describes himself to be honest and God-fearing. He operates a food stall where he sells french fries and snacks. He has been involved in this business for nine years. His business is located at a strategic area and his  customers are local residents. 

Stephen describes his biggest business challenge to be occasional shortage of potatoes for preparing snacks and french fries. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase potatoes for preparing snacks and french fries to sell. Stephen's business goal is to venture into a retail shop within five years.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes for preparing french fries and snacks to sell

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with four children. 

Merlyn has a retail shop where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Merlyn is  a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Merlyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is 41 years old and has seven children. Luciana is married and has four children who are in school.

Luciana is in the agricultural business "marcotting" (doing aerial layering for plant propagation) in the Philippines. Luciana requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy a greater variety of plants and fertilizers.

Luciana has been "marcotting" for five years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Luciana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of plants and fertilizers.

loans.name: Welda

texts.en:
Welda is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Welda is providing "motorela" or motorcycle transport with side car with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the service.

Welda is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Welda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the service

loans.name: Elazabeth

texts.en: Elazabeth is a 40-year-old married woman. She has four children, ranging in age from 10 to 15 years. She describes herself as honest and kind. She operates a food store where she sells food, tea, snacks, etc. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a very busy area, and her customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the restaurant. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to purchase ingredients such as sugar, wheat flour, maize flour, and salt for preparing food. Elazabeth's business goal is to run several hotels within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as sugar, wheat flour, maize flour, and salt for preparing food to sell.

loans.name: Janina

texts.es: Janina, de 24 años, es una mujer joven muy amable, es madre de Meylin de 2 años, vive en su casa propia a lado de su conviviente Carlos de 28 años. Ella desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, es por eso que se esfuerza mucho en su trabajo. El trabajo de Janina consiste en la venta de ropa y zapatos, durante mucho tiempo sufrió algunos contratiempos en su vida, esto debido a que no tenía un ingreso propio de dinero para su casa, es por eso que desde hace un año decidió empezar un nuevo proyecto. Pensó que sus amigos, vecinos o familiares desearían comprar prendas de vestir o zapatos dependiendo de la temporada que estén, es así que inicio su negocio que ahora le da muy buenos resultados. Le gusta lo que hace, pues le permite tener tiempo para poder estar a lado de su menor hija, además que desde que empezó con su negocio le está yendo bien en su economía, ya que tienen dos ingresos para su hogar. Desea seguir creciendo y es por eso que tiene en mente ampliar sus ventas y poder ofrecer mayor variedad y calidad de prendas a sus clientes. Este será el crédito número 3 con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado se compromete una vez mas a pagar de manera puntual con sus cuotas y demostrar como en anteriores oportunidades que es una socia muy buena y así retribuir el apoyo que le brindan en su banco comunal en donde todos son muy responsables y solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará más mercaderías ya que desea armar su campaña escolar y ofrecer uniformes y zapatos de colegio.
texts.en: Janina, who is 24 years old, is a very kind young lady.  She is the mother of Meylin, who is 2 years old.  She lives in her own house along with her live-in partner, Carlos, who is 28 years old.  She wants to offer a better quality of life to her family.  This is why she puts a lot of effort into her work.  Janina's work consists of selling clothing and shoes.  For quite some time she suffered some setbacks in her life.  This is because she did not have her own monetary income for her house.  It is for this reason that she decided a year ago to begin a new project.  She thought that her friends, neighbors, or relatives would want to buy clothing garments or shoes depending on the current season.  It is in this way that she began her business that is now giving her very good results.  She likes what she does, because it allows her to have time to be able to be with her young daughter.  Furthermore, since she began her business, she has been doing well economically, since they have two household incomes.  She wants to continue growing, and that is why she has in mind increasing her sales and being able to offer a greater variety and quality of garments to her customers.  This will be the 3rd loan with MFP, so she expects their collaboration to continue with her objectives.  On the other hand, she promises to pay her dues again in a punctual manner and to demonstrate, as in previous opportunities, that she is a very good partner.  In this way she will reward the support that is offered to her by her communal bank, where everyone is very responsible and supportive.  With the amount requested, 1500 soles, she will buy more merchandise since she desires to supply her scholastic campaign and offer school uniforms and shoes.

loans.use: buy school shoes and school uniforms.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda is 51 years old and widowed with eight children. With three children in school, Leonarda works very hard to provide for them.

Leonarda runs a grocery store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more products to sell in her grocery store.

Leonarda has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as rice grains, sugar and other groceries. 

In the future, Leonarda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Judith has a retail shop where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Judith is  a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Judith hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages for sell

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child. 

Antonio has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

Antonio is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Antonio hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Irene Jean

texts.en:
Irene Jean is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.

Irene Jean has a retail shop in which she sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Irene Jean is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Irene Jean hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Aiza

texts.en:
Aiza is 18 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child.

Aiza has a shop in which she sells clothing and beauty products from Natasha and Avon. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of Natasha and Avon products to sell.

Aiza is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Aiza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of Natasha and Avon products to sell.

loans.name: Morita

texts.en: For this loan, Morita is borrowing 26,000 PHP to fund her livestock business. The livestock business that she previously funded through NWTF and KIVA continues to provide her and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to sell.

loans.name: Janith

texts.en:
Janith is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and had three children.

Janith has a retail shop in which she sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Janith is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Janith hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Juana Lucia

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer de 62 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de comida.

Su historia empezó por que se dio la oportunidad de abrir su negocio y porque la gente me decía que sabia cocinar y por eso decidí abrir mi negocio, trabaja con su hija los días lunes a domingo de 8:00AM hasta las 15:00PM sus dificultades son el transporte para ir a comprar las legumbres y la cantidad de clientes que no me abastezco para atender, está casada y el esposo es maestro constructor, tiene 1 hijo que tiene 24 años.

Su sueño es abrir otro local y controlar personas para que hagan el trabajo de cocinar y terminar de construir mi casa. Por eso quiere el préstamo para invertir en su venta de comida comprando arroz, carnes, enlatdos, granos.
texts.en:
Juana is 62 years old and really hopes that her food business will succeed in the next few years.

Juana began her career when she had the chance to open her own business.  People told her that she was good at cooking and so she decided to go into business.  She works with her daughter Mondays to Sundays from 8:00 AM until 3:00 PM.  Her main difficulty has been transportation, both in terms of going to purchase vegetables and in the amount of customers she is able to serve.  Juana is married; her husband is a construction foreman, and they have 1 son who is 24 years old.

Juana’s goal is to open another location and to hire people who can cook and finish building her house.  She wants to use the loan to invest in her food business by purchasing rice, meat, canned goods, and grain.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as rice, meat, and canned goods.

loans.name: Aram

texts.en:
Aram is 43 years old. He lives in Ijevan with his wife, three children and his retired father. Aram’s children, two sons and a daughter, are school-aged. His wife is engaged in a clothes trading business.

In the past Aram worked at road-building company as a worker, then at a Ijevan electrical company as an electrician. Now he continues on working as an electrician at a construction organization. Simultaneously with his hired work, Aram also fulfills private orders for electricity connection and service.  This occupation allows Aram to meet most of his family’s needs. 

This is Aram’s 5th loan from Nor Horizon and he has never been delayed in his repayments.  Now he needs a 700,000 AMD loan to buy necessary tools and materials for his business.

loans.use: buy electrical tools and materials

loans.name: Alawiya

texts.en:
Alawiya is is 38-year-old married woman with five children, four of them are in school.  She has run a business selling tea in Kator, South Sudan, for one year.

Alawiya is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and coffee.   She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: buy sugar and coffee

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en: Fredrick is a 25-year-old single man. He has 3 children with ages ranging from 1 year to 2 years. He describes himself as honest, kind and social. He operates a barber shop where he provides shaving services. He has been involved in this business for 2 years.  His business is located near a railway station and his primary customers are local residents. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase barber shop items such as a shaving machine. Fredrick's business goal is to expand his barber shop  within 5 years.

loans.use: buy barber shop tools

loans.name: Noch

texts.en:
Noch, age 51, is a hard-working mother who has been engaged in agri-business for ages.  Her common crops are rice, potatoes and corn. She cannot manage all the farming tasks unless there is help from her husband.  She is able to generate in the neighborhood of $2.00 per day from her business.
 
This present time, Noch is preparing her soil again in order to grow yellow corn.  She will need some capital to invest in her corn farming.  After her corn crop is fully-grown, she hopes to make a good income from it.  Noch wishes to provide her school-age children with further education until they graduate from university.

loans.use: invest in her corn farm

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 32 year old.  She is a married woman with five children, four of them are in school.  She has run a business selling charcoal in Kator, South Sudan, for three years.

Sarah is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal.  She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: buy charcoal

loans.name: Juan Aurelio

texts.es: Juan Aurelio es un personas trabajadora que toda la vida ha luchado por salir adelante, el trabaja como ingeniero en la alcaldía de la comunidad ya tiene años de trabajar en ese lugar. Juan Aurelio tiene 2 hijos que todavía están a su cargo y que están estudian, ambos  hijos están en la universidad y ese era uno de sus sueños de que sus hijos culminen sus estudios, otro de los sueños de Juan Aurelio es de remodelar su vivienda que adquirió con mucho esfuerzos. Juan Aurelio está solicitando financiamiento para comprar bloque, cemento, hierro, arena entre otros materiales de construcción.
texts.en: Juan Aurelio is a hardworking man who has fought all his life to get ahead.  He has worked as an engineer at the mayor's office for many years.  Juan has 2 children still under his care.  Both of his children are studying at the university, and one of Juan's dreams is to see his children finish their education. Another dream of Juan's is to make repairs and remodel the house he worked so hard for.  He is requesting this loan to purchase construction materials such as cement, corrugated iron and sand.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, corrugated iron and other construction materials.

loans.name: Ma. Corazon

texts.en: This time Ma. Corazon is borrowing PHP 10,000 to fund her sari-sari store business.  The sari-sari store business that she previously funded through NWTF and KIVA continues to provide her with income to improve her business operations.

loans.use: buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Medalin

texts.en:
Medalin is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 

Medalin has a food shop that sells viands & snacks like rice cakes, hotdogs & chicken barbecue.  She has had this business for 2 years. 

Medalin requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks & viands.  Medalin is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks & viands

loans.name: Herlinda Lorena

texts.es:
Lorena es una mujer que tiene 44 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de cosméticos.

Su historia empezó cuando la cliente trabaja en una casa por más de 10 años, cuando la familia para la que trabaja viajo, se quedo sin trabajo y se decidió a vender cosméticos, y así empezó con el trabajo como hace su trabajo pues bien sale todas las tardes a entregar sus productos y a cobrar sus dificultades son la delincuencia.

Sus sueños so terminar su casa y lograr que su hijo sea un profesional. Por eso quiere el préstamo lo va a invertir en su negocio comprando perfumes, cosmeticos y papeleria.
texts.en: Lorena is a 44 year old woman who has great aspirations to grow her cosmetic business in the coming years.   Lorena's story began after she'd worked in the house of a family for more than 10 years.  When the family left, she was left without any work and she decided to start selling cosmetics.  Now she works every afternoon to sell her products as well as collect the money owed to her.  Lorena's dream is to see her son have a good profession.  She is requesting a loan to invest in her business, and will use the money to purchase perfumes, cosmetics and stationery to sell.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, cosmetics and stationery for her business.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 36 years old and married.  She has 4 children, 2 of them are in school.

Maricel is in the agricultural business raising livestock in the Philippines.  She has been raising livestocks for 8 years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Maricel requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy more livestock to raise and sell.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy livestock

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina is 49 years old and married.  She has seven children, two of them are in school.

Merlina is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines.    She has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Merlina requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy medicines and feeds for her pigs.  In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her piggery business.

loans.use: buy medicines and feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 33 years old.  She is married with three children.

Marilou works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like canned goods, snack food and other groceries.

Marilou has borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from rice retailing and food vending.

Marilou aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy food items

loans.name: Nestor

texts.es:
Néstor es un padre de familia de 34 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos de los cuales son menores de edad, viven en un caserío anexo del distrito de Morrope perteneciente al distrito de Lambayeque a unos 60 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo aproximadamente. En la zona en la que viven cuentan con actividad económica principal la agricultura y la ganadería.


Néstor se dedica de manera diaria a la crianza y posterior comercialización de animales  como ganado, ovinos y aves de corral como: patos, pavos, cuyes, entre otros, actividad a la que se ha dedicado siempre teniendo ya un aproximado de 10 años como experiencia, negocio al que se ha dedicado desde muy pequeño junto a sus padres quienes le enseñaron a la compra/venta de animales. Para lo que podido instalar en su propia casa espacios estratégicos para la crianza de los mismos, adicionalmente también se genera ingresos diarios trabajando como jornalero en los diferentes fundos cercanos a su caserío, la unión entre él y su esposa han hecho que emprendan en nuevos objetivos familiares y es que por eso trabajan diariamente para lograrlos y así mejorar su condición de vida.

Néstor al tener ya sus objetivos claros y establecidos desea comprar alimentos balanceados los cuales servirán para el engorde de sus animales y a la vez la compra de más animales con la finalidad de aumentar sus ventas. Néstor ha solicitado un crédito en Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 2000 Nuevos Soles los cuales ayudaran a generar mayores ingresos con los que podrán mejorar su calidad de vida y a la vez para pagar su crédito solicitado.
