Néstor, anteriormente ha tenido ya un crédito con nuestra institución el cual  ha sido pagado de acuerdo a su cronograma quedando como muy buen cliente, pues se sabe que es muy responsable con todos sus compromisos asumidos.
texts.en:
Nestor is a 44 year old father who lives with his wife and their 3 children in a small village.  All of their children are still young.  They live in the district of Morrope, about 60 minutes outside of the city of Chiclayo.  In the zone where they live,  people count primarily on agriculture and livestock for their income.  

Nestor works daily raising and selling animals such as sheep, ducks, turkeys, guinea pigs among others.  He has been doing this work for approximately 10 years now, but he learned the business from his parents when he was younger. They taught him about buying and selling animals.  He has set up special areas in his home where he can raise the animals.  Juan also earns additional money each day by working as a laborer in his village.  He works very hard every day to try improve the quality of life for his family.  

Nestor has clear goals in mind.  He wants to purchase good quality food for his animals, and he wants to purchase new animals as well to increase his sales.   Nestor is requesting a loan to invest in his business, which will help increase his income, the quality of life for his family, and allow him to make his loan payments on time.   Nestor had a previous loan with this institution.  He made timely payments and is considered a good client, very responsible and able to meet his commitments.  
.

loans.use: to purchase good quality food and livestock for his business.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas is a 44 year old divorced woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 6 years to 21 year. She describes herself to be hardworking. She operates a grocery store where she sells tomatoes, onions, eggs, mangoes, potatoes, kale, carrots etc. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a viable area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be shortage of vegetables and fruits. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase more vegetables for selling. Dorcas's business goal is to increase her customer base size within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will be a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for selling.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: Karina, de 34 años, es una mujer buena y amable, trabaja mucho ya que desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus padres y sus hermanos. Es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus padres y comparte con ellos la ecuación de sus hermanos. El trabajo de Karina consiste en la venta de artículos de oficina, en su casa acondicionó un espacio en donde ofrece una gran variedad de artículos, entre cuadernos, lapiceros, lápices y todo lo que el cliente necesita. Lleva recién tres meses trabajando con éste negocio en el cual recibe la ayuda de su madre y algunas veces de sus hermanos. Le gusta su trabajo pues se siente independiente y puede disponer de su tiempo, además significa un ingreso extra, pues ella trabaja en una polleria. El negocio que tiene en su casa es un complemento a los ingresos generales que recibe cada mens. Desea ampliar su negocio y ofrecer otros tipos de productos como abarrotes y mas, pero sabe que para eso debe tener una buena inversión. Espera crecer y lograr tener una negocio prospero y muy grande. Este será el primer crédito con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con lo que hace. Con el monto solicitado de 600 soles, comprará mercadería para su negocio, ya que viene la campaña escolar y desea comprar variedad de productos para esta campaña.
texts.en:
Karina, 34, is a good and pleasant woman.  She works a lot because she wants to give her parents and siblings a better quality of life.  She is single and has no children.

Karina's job consists of selling office supplies.  In her house she equipped a space where she offers a wide variety of supplies, including notebooks, pens, pencils, and everything the customer needs.  She has been working with this business for just three months, and she has the help of her mother and sometimes her siblings.  She likes her job because she feels independent and she is able to have time at her disposal.  Also, it means another income because she works in a poultry store.

The business she has in her house is a complement to the general income she receives every month.  She wants to expand her business and offer other types of products such as groceries and more, but she knows that for that she must have a good investment.  She hopes to grow and have a prosperous and big business.

This will be her first loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she will have some financial help because in that way she will feel more secure about getting ahead with what she does.

With the requested loan of 600 PEN she will buy merchandise for her business because the school season is coming and she wants to buy a variety of products for this season.

loans.use: to buy office and school supplies.

loans.name: Tavitai

texts.en: Tavitai is 41 years old and lives with his wife and 3 kids in Hovd province of Western Mongolia. His wife works as a shop assistant and his kids study at the high school. He used to run a taxi service between the cities and then started the wooden products business. The business went well because he gained enough experience and gained some profits which was spent on building his working space. He is well known for his talent to craft wooden products. He makes them based on the customers' order and interests. His further plan is to expand the business by purchasing needed tools for the business and to save for his sons college fees. He is a talented man who says that "I would like to expand my business and make it easier by using more tools and hiring someone". The total amount he is requesting is 1,500,000 MNT for the carpenter tools.

loans.use: To purchase carpenter tools

loans.name: Davaachuluun

texts.en: Davaachuluun is a 44-year-old woman who lives with her husband and 2 daughters in Hovd province of Western Mongolia. Her husband is an entrepreneur and her 2 daughters study at a college. She has been running a meat and livestock retailing business since 1995. Her husband gets the supplies from the neighbor provinces and she retails them at the big market. She got experienced in the field and this business income is the only financial source for the family. She would like to make a business expansion by getting supplies in large quantities due to the approach of the biggest festival in Mongolia. She is a really diligent woman who says that "I want to expand my business so that I could improve my family income and living standard". The total amount she is requesting is 2,000,000 MNT for the supplies (livestock).

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman. She has three children, and all are enrolled in school. 

Asha operates a charcoal and firewood selling business and sells her goods from home. She's worked in this business for six years. Her primary customers are her neighbors and passersby. 

She describes her greatest business challenges to be seasonality and insecurity, and her highest monthly expenses are food and school fees. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Asha will use the 40,000 Kenyan shilling loan to purchase more stock of charcoal and firewood for resale. Asha aspires to expand her business in the future. She joined Yehu because it offers quality financial services.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of charcoal and firewood for resale.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 37 years old and blessed with three children aged 15, 10 and five years respectively. She sells clothes, a business she ventured into five years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES.10,000. She has requested a loan of KES 20,000 that she will use to purchase bales of clothes for sale. 

The profit she earns from this business would help her expand her business and repay her loan. Her dream is to see her business expand to greater levels. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase bales of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Byamba

texts.en:
Byamba is a 51-year-old woman who lives with her husband and three children in Hovd province. Her husband is a retiree, and the oldest girl studies at the college. 

She started her business of making Buriad (a traditional style) boots in 2000. Since then, she extended the types of products and built a workplace. She also repairs the shoes. 

Her plan is to purchase the boot-making materials in large quantities due to the approach of the biggest festival, where there will be many orders. 

She is a responsible person who says that, "I would like to extend the business by purchasing [a] large amount so that I could raise the income and save for the three kids' college fees." 

The total amount she is requesting is 1,500,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) for the materials, such as leather, decorations and fabrics.

loans.use: To purchase materials like leather, decorations and fabrics.

loans.name: Djavid

texts.ru: 5 let nazad Djavid stal taxistom. Snachalo on ne imel svoyu mashinu i poeotmu on rabotal shoferom. No seychas u nego yest svoya mashina. On nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti chtobi pochinit svoyu mashinu dlya udobstva kliyentov. Djavid 27 let. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey. Djavid jivet v Fizuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda. Внутренне перемещённое лицо (ВПЛ) - человек, который был вынужден внезапно бежать из своего дома в результате вооружённого конфликта, насилия, нарушений прав человека, стихийных бедствий или других катастроф, но, в отличие от беженца, не перешел международную границу и находящийся на территории собственной страны (источник: Управления ООН по Координации Гуманитарных Вопросов).
texts.en:
Five years ago Djavid started working as a taxi driver. He didn't own his cab at first, so he was just a chauffeur. Now, however, he drives his own cab. Djavid needs a loan of 2000 AZN in order to purchase some spare parts and repair his car to make it more comfortable. 
Djavid is twenty-seven years old, married and has two children. They live in the Fuzuli region. Djavid is an IDP (Internally displaced person) originally from the city of Fuzuli. 

Internally displaced persons, as defined by a UN report "Guiding Principles on Internal Displacement," are persons or groups of persons who have been forced or obliged to flee or to leave their homes or places of habitual residence, in particular as a result of or in order to avoid the effects of armed conflict, situations of generalized violence, violations of human rights or natural or human-made disasters, and who have not crossed an internationally recognized State border.

loans.use: to purchase parts in order to repair his taxi cab.
